name: Marco Antonio Berto

text: Ainda com relaÃ§Ã£o ao Quadro Geral de Credores - QGC - meus alunos e clientes me perguntaram mais algumas coisas (que interpretei como dÃºvidas e assim esclareci):  A RecuperaÃ§Ã£o Judicial Ã© um mecanismo que visa reestruturar as dÃ­vidas de uma empresa em dificuldade financeira, buscando preservar sua viabilidade econÃ´mica e social. Dentro desse contexto, o quadro geral de credores desempenha um papel fundamental. Vamos explorar a importÃ¢ncia desse quadro:  ### 1. **TransparÃªncia e OrganizaÃ§Ã£o** O quadro geral de credores proporciona uma visÃ£o clara e organizada das dÃ­vidas da empresa, listando todos os credores e os valores devidos. Essa transparÃªncia Ã© essencial para que todos os envolvidos compreendam a real situaÃ§Ã£o financeira da empresa.  ### 2. **Prioridade de Pagamentos** No processo de recuperaÃ§Ã£o, Ã© crucial entender a ordem de prioridade dos credores. O quadro geral ajuda a identificar quais sÃ£o os credores com garantias reais, os quirografÃ¡rios (sem garantias) e os preferenciais. Isso impacta diretamente nas estratÃ©gias de negociaÃ§Ã£o e pagamento.  ### 3. **NegociaÃ§Ã£o e Acordos** Com um quadro bem estruturado, a empresa pode abordar os credores de forma mais eficaz, propondo acordos que sejam viÃ¡veis e justos. Compreender a totalidade das dÃ­vidas permite que a empresa faÃ§a propostas que considerem a capacidade de pagamento e a urgÃªncia dos credores.  ### 4. **Planejamento da RecuperaÃ§Ã£o** A anÃ¡lise do quadro geral de credores Ã© essencial para o planejamento da recuperaÃ§Ã£o. A empresa pode elaborar um plano que leve em conta as condiÃ§Ãµes de cada grupo de credores, buscando soluÃ§Ãµes que equilibrem os interesses de todos.  ### 5. **ConfianÃ§a no Processo** A elaboraÃ§Ã£o do quadro geral de credores pode aumentar a confianÃ§a de investidores e parceiros na recuperaÃ§Ã£o da empresa. Isso Ã© importante para a captaÃ§Ã£o de novos recursos, que podem ser necessÃ¡rios para a reestruturaÃ§Ã£o e continuidade das operaÃ§Ãµes.  ### 6. **Acompanhamento Judicial** O quadro tambÃ©m Ã© relevante no Ã¢mbito judicial. Ele serve como um documento importante para o juiz e para os advogados, facilitando a anÃ¡lise do caso e garantindo que todos os credores sejam devidamente contemplados no processo.  ### 7. **Evitar Fraudes e Conflitos** Um quadro geral bem elaborado ajuda a evitar fraudes e conflitos entre credores. Ele assegura que todos os credores sejam tratados de maneira justa, minimizando o risco de aÃ§Ãµes judiciais paralelas que possam atrasar ou comprometer o processo de recuperaÃ§Ã£o.  ConclusÃ£o  Em sÃ­ntese, o quadro geral de credores Ã© uma ferramenta essencial para o sucesso da RecuperaÃ§Ã£o Judicial. Ele promove a transparÃªncia, facilita a negociaÃ§Ã£o e assegura um tratamento justo entre os credores, contribuindo para a reestruturaÃ§Ã£o eficiente da empresa e, consequentemente, sua sobrevivÃªncia no mercado. A sua correta elaboraÃ§Ã£o e atualizaÃ§Ã£o sÃ£o fundamentais para que a recuperaÃ§Ã£o seja bem-sucedida e beneficie tanto a empresa quanto seus credores.

text: El discurso debe de ser la Biodiversidad, no el Cambio ClimÃ¡tico. En mis 15 aÃ±os trabajando en y con proyectos del llamado "Sector Verde" que comprenden la "Biodiversidad y el Cambio ClimÃ¡tico y el hecho de estar en el tema por mÃ¡s de 30 aÃ±os de manera voluntaria, cada vez estoy mÃ¡s convencido que la "polÃ­tica mundial" tiene el discurso equivocado, se habla de "Cambio ClimÃ¡tico" un tema que tiene seguidores como detractores y ambos con muy buenos argumentos, donde es difÃ­cil que un parte logre convencer a la otra, mÃ¡s aÃºn si uno no tiene los argumentos de los expertos a la mano. El "Cambio ClimÃ¡tico" tambiÃ©n es discurso con fines econÃ³micos que terminan perjudicando a la Biodiversidad, que para mi es la fuente de la sostenibilidad, el Eden, la esperanza de la Humanidad. Bajo el argumento de "Cambio ClimÃ¡tico" se motivÃ³ la energÃ­a eÃ³lica que mata a millones de aves a nivel mundial, se justifican enormes instalaciones de energÃ­a fotovoltaica, que tambiÃ©n matan la visa silvestre y no permite la generaciÃ³n de plantas, se motiva los motores elÃ©ctricos sin proporcionar una soluciÃ³n al reciclaje de las contaminantes baterias (a la larga la mejor generaciÃ³n de energÃ­a renovable son las HidroelÃ©ctricas, que si bien cortan ecosistemas y al construirse causan un gran impacto, terminan protegiendo los bosques y la vida que hay en ella, pues los requieren para que continue la generaciÃ³n de agua, pero han sido satanizadas polÃ­ticamente) El Cambio ClimÃ¡tico... como todo en Occidente, termina siendo un negocio, para los que estÃ¡n en las energÃ­as renovables es inminente, para los negacionistas el combustible fÃ³sil sigue siendo la mejor opciÃ³n....Pero si enfatizamos la Biodiversidad y hacemos conciencia respecto a algo que si se estÃ¡ perdiendo, como la recarga hÃ­drica, la pÃ©rdida de vida silvestre, de insectos, animales y su hÃ¡bitat... el Cambio ClimÃ¡tico estarÃ¡ cubierto de cajÃ³n.

Location: Yamagata, Japan Job Type: Full-time Are you passionate about culinary excellence and seeking a unique opportunity to showcase your skills amidst breathtaking mountain scenery? Join our team as a Chef at a renowned ski lodge in Yamagata, Japan, where you'll have the chance to create unforgettable dining experiences for our guests. We are looking for a talented and experienced Chef to lead our restaurant kitchen and deliver exceptional cuisine that complements our guests' fantastic adventures on the slopes.  Responsibilities: â€¢ Oversee all aspects of the kitchen operations, ensuring the highest level of food quality, presentation, and taste. â€¢ Create innovative and seasonally inspired menus that cater to a diverse clientele. â€¢ Train, supervise, and motivate a team of kitchen staff to maintain a smooth and efficient operation. â€¢ Monitor and manage food costs, inventory, and supplies, ensuring optimal utilisation and minimising waste. â€¢ Collaborate with management to develop new concepts and ideas for special events and themed dining experiences. â€¢ Maintain a safe and sanitary work environment, following all food safety and hygiene standards. â€¢ Continuously strive for excellence, staying up to date with culinary trends and techniques.  Requirements: â€¢ Previous experience working as a Chef in a high-volume restaurant or hotel environment. â€¢ Profound knowledge of Japanese cuisine, including traditional and regional dishes. â€¢ Ability to create visually appealing presentations that are as pleasing to the eye as they are to the palate. â€¢ Strong leadership and communication skills to effectively manage and inspire a team. â€¢ Excellent organisational and time management abilities, with the capacity to multitask and prioritise. â€¢ Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as per the demands of the ski lodge industry. â€¢ Fluency in English and Japanese, enabling effective communication with guests and staff.  Benefits: â€¢ Competitive salary commensurate with experience and qualifications. â€¢ Accommodation within the ski lodge premises. â€¢ Opportunities for professional development and training. â€¢ Immersive cultural experience in the beautiful surroundings  To Apply: If you are excited about working in a dynamic ski lodge environment and delivering extraordinary culinary experiences, we would like to hear from you. name: Simon Vilaisarn
position: Championing Financial Inclusion Through Disruptive Innovation
text: Visaâ€™s new collaboration with QR payment providers across Asia Pacific aims to make cross-border payments more convenient and secure for consumers.  For businesses, this approach has the potential to expand customer reach and reduce payment processing costs, especially for small and medium-sized enterprises. With lower fees than traditional card payments, QR integration allows businesses to attract international customers and promotes the adoption of cashless transactions in a straightforward, accessible way, potentially transforming the Asia Pacific payments ecosystem into a more connected and interoperable network.

name: MightyID Communication Inc
text: ğŸ“¢ Due Diligence and Peer Review - Key Steps to Ensuring Quality for Start-up Visa Canada Projects! In the journey of starting a business in Canada, ensuring transparency and quality in your project is crucial. This is why Due Diligence and Peer Review are considered two essential processes that help investors and regulatory authorities thoroughly evaluate the feasibility and potential of your project. However, with recent changes, entrepreneurs must stay updated to better prepare for participation in the Start-up Visa program. ğŸš€ Due Diligence - Comprehensive Assessment Before Investment Decisions Are you ready to answer questions about your finances, legal framework, and business model? Due Diligence is a process that helps investors examine and evaluate every detail before committing to your project. Transparency and risk control are critical factors for a project to succeed. This is a step that every start-up must undergo to demonstrate solid preparation and growth potential. ğŸ’¼ Peer Review - Enhancing Project Credibility Through Independent Evaluation Previously, Peer Review was an independent evaluation step to confirm that your project is valuable and trustworthy. Experts would assess the quality, innovation, and economic potential of the project, ensuring that supporting organizations back only projects that contribute meaningfully to Canadaâ€™s economy. However, as of August 1, 2024, Peer Review has been suspendedâ€”no new requests are being accepted, and all ongoing processes have been canceled. âš ï¸ What Does the Suspension of Peer Review Mean? Peer Review once acted as a "shield" to protect start-ups against fraud, ensuring that entrepreneurs and supporting organizations adhered to industry standards. Its suspension marks a significant shift, with IRCC officers now directly evaluating and questioning projects instead of relying on an independent expert panel. ğŸ“Œ New Challenges Without Peer Review Without Peer Review, IRCC officers will make quicker decisions, leaving businesses with limited time to prepare. This means entrepreneurs must prepare their applications more thoroughly and clearly than ever before. You need to ensure that all information about your finances, business plan, and project operations is ready to convince IRCC officers from the outset. âœ¨ Tips for Success: Prepare detailed and comprehensive documentation, from finances to business plans, to increase your chances of success in the Start-up Visa application process. Ensure you have sufficient documents and evidence to substantiate your project without relying on the Peer Review timeline. ğŸ’¬ Questions about the Due Diligence process or recent changes to the Start-up Visa program? Leave a comment or message us. Our team is ready to support and answer all your questions to help you prepare for your start-up journey in Canada!  Hotline: 078-555-2875 Website: Email: Address: 64 Truong Dinh, Vo Thi Sau Ward, District 3

name: å¤§å¶‹å®¹å¸‚
text: Tax Revenue Enhancement Strategies and the Japan New Deal Plan  Overview  The tax revenue enhancement strategies are based on the Japan New Deal Plan, aimed at economic recovery and sustainable growth. This plan involves national investment and structural reforms to increase tax revenue in both the short and long term, while strengthening Japanâ€™s global competitiveness.   ---  Strategy 1: Institutionalizing Medical Tourism  Description: Leverage Japan's advanced medical technologies to establish medical tourism. Promote the international certification of acupuncture, osteopathy, massage, and other medical practices to attract foreign patients.  Goal: Increase tax revenue by promoting medical tourism.  Relation to the Japan New Deal Plan: Position medical tourism as a national strategy, investing in infrastructure and promoting international standardization.   Strategy 2: International Certification of Cultural Resources  Description: Promote the international certification of Japanese cultural assets such as bonsai, Japanese gardens, acupuncture, massage, and osteopathy, offering foreigners the opportunity to obtain these qualifications.  Goal: Increase tax revenue by gaining international recognition for Japan's unique cultural practices and techniques.  Relation to the Japan New Deal Plan: Develop a global strategy to promote Japanese culture and implement international marketing and qualification programs.   Strategy 3: Introduction of Medical Tourism Visas  Description: Establish a new short-term medical tourism visa to simplify the process for foreign patients seeking medical services.  Goal: Expand the medical tourism market and increase tax revenue.  Relation to the Japan New Deal Plan: Integrate medical tourism into the national strategy and support visa system reform.   Strategy 4: Standardization of Domestic Events  Description: Standardize domestic cultural events and tourism festivals to streamline promotions, and develop new tourist routes using regional resources.  Goal: Stimulate regional tourism and increase tourism tax revenue.  Relation to the Japan New Deal Plan: Support regional revitalization through event standardization and the development of tourism infrastructure.   Strategy 5: Establishment of Special Zones and Regulatory Relaxation  Description: Designate specific regions as special zones for medical and cultural tourism, relaxing regulations to attract foreign investors.  Goal: Promote regional economic growth and increase tax revenue.  Relation to the Japan New Deal Plan: Support the establishment of special zones and invest in regulatory reform and infrastructure development.

name: Hong Soon Chin
position: Doctor of Philosophy/ Chief Operating Officer
text: Building on the previous post:  The extensive AMR bacterial collection available in our store is as follows:  Klebsiella pneumoniae subsp. pneumoniae (ESBL positive) ATCC 700603 A Gram-negative bacterium found in the normal flora of the mouth, skin, and intestines. It can cause destructive changes to human and animal lungs if aspirated (inhaled), specifically to the alveoli (in the lungs) resulting in bloody sputum (mixture of saliva and mucus).  Klebsiella pneumoniae, carbapenem-resistant NCTC 13438 Gram-negative bacteria are found in the normal flora of the mouth, skin, and intestines. Causes bloody sputum (a mixture of saliva and mucus) if inhaled by humans and animals. Often resistant to multiple antibiotics and now carbapenem  Neisseria gonorrhoeae, penicillin-resistant ATCC 49981 Gram-negative bacteria. Of the 11 species, only 2 are pathogenic. Causes gonorrhoea (sexually transmitted infection) and is transmitted through sexual contact.  Neisseria gonorrhoeae, cephalosporin-resistant CDC SPL-4 Gram-negative bacteria that cause infection of the genitals, throat, and eyes. Resistant to penicillin. The current treatment is with cephalosporin. Efforts to develop a vaccine are underway.  Pseudomonas aeruginosa, multidrug-resistant ATCC BAA-2108 Gram-negative bacteria that cause pneumonia (acute bronchus inflammation), bloodstream infections, surgical site infections and urinary tract infections. Carbapenem is the 'last line of defence against gram-negative bacteria but is increasingly ineffective against P. aeruginosa.  Staphylococcus aureus subsp. aureus, methicillin-resistant; reduced vancomycin susceptibility ATCC 700699 MRSA with reduced Vancomycin susceptibility (VISA) has been reported in several countries. VISA isolates are rare, but some strains have been discovered to have a subpopulation of resistant cells (heterogeneous VISA- hVISA).  Staphylococcus epidermidis, methicillin-resistant ATCC 51625 An antimicrobial-resistant variant of S. epidermidis. Causes infection in those with catheters or surgical implants as the pathogen forms biofilms that grow on these devices.  Streptococcus pneumoniae, low level penicillin-resistant ATCC 49619 Gram-positive bacteria are a clone of S. pneumoniae emerging from Switzerland. Leading cause of potentially life-threatening community-acquired diseases.  Streptococcus pneumoniae, penicillin-resistant ATCC 700903 The most common cause of community-acquired respiratory-tract infection, causing meningitis (inflammation of the area surrounding the brain and spinal cord) and otitis media (the middle ear inflammation). Many isolates develop multidrug-resistant species (MDRSP) causing huge problems in healthcare facilities.  Please contact Viroxy for disinfectant efficacy testing using these AMR bacteria. We also welcome commercial or research collaborations focused on AMR bacterial studies.

name: Fina Dwi Rahmadaningsih
position: International Relations and SDGs Enthusiast | Researcher | Analyst | Executive Assistant | Instagaram Influencer and Content Creator
text: Celebrating 75 Years of Friendship Between the United States and Indonesia!   Photo 1 : H.E. Mr. Ambassador Sung Y. Kim, U.S. Ambassador to the Republic of Indonesia and Miss Fina Dwi Rahmadaningsih  H.E. Sung Y. Kim became the U.S. Ambassador to the Republic of Indonesia for the period 2020-2023. Ambassador Kim departed Indonesia on November 20 , 2023 after a successful and memorable three years in the country.  His Excellency remarkable duties in Indonesia during the period of 2020-2023: - Delivered covid vaccines to tens of millions of Indonesians. - Issued more than 100,000 visas in the past year (2023). - Hosted the U.S. President visit to Indonesia during the 2022 G20 Summit in Bali. - Hosted the Vice President visit to Indonesia during the 2023 ASEAN Summit in Jakarta. - Hosted the U.S. Secretary of State four times to Indonesia. - Elevating the partnership to a comprehensive strategic partnership between Indonesia and the U.S. in the areas of economy, education, environment, security, and defense.  Photo 2 : H.E. Mr. Jeffery P. Cohen (Pak Jeff), USAID Indonesia Misssion Director and Miss Fina Dwi Rahmadaningsih  H.E. Jeffery (Jeff) P. Cohen is a Senior Foreign Service Officer with the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID). While sharing his works on USAID Indonesia's social media, Mr. Cohen humbly known as Pak Jeff with the popular hashtag   U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) has partnered with Indonesia for decades to protect the environment, build infrastructure, and strengthen health system and economy. With an annual program budget of about $100 million, USAID carries out programs in democratic governance, anti-corruption, climate and the environment, economic growth, education, and health. USAID also respond to public health and humanitarian crises, including the COVID-19 pandemic with main partners include the national and local governments, local leaders, the private sector, civil society, and donors.  Photo 3 : Mr. Jeremy Hinch, Editor & Communications Specialist at USAID Indonesia and Miss Fina Dwi Rahmadaningsih    @usembassyjkt @indonesiaindc @statedept @kemlu_ri

position: Business Development Manager at SREE AMBICA STATIONERS
text: Hi we are Hiring for " SAP BASIS S/4 HANA Systems Administrator & Maintenance SAP Environment Consultant " Location : Singapore Duration : Contract to Hire / One year renewal Contract. Visa Type : Singaporean/ P.R/ ( As EP Quota not available ) Resource must be in Singapore. Notice period : 30 Days.  Key Responsibilities :  Administer and maintain SAP environments, including SAP ECC, S/4HANA, BW/4HANA, Solution Manager, Portal and SAP HANA databases, oracle database and Maxdb. Perform installation, configuration, and upgrades of SAP systems (e.g., ECC, S/4HANA, BW, PI/PO, etc.). Manage user accounts, roles, and authorizations within SAP systems. Monitor system performance and perform proactive tuning to ensure optimal system availability and responsiveness. Execute SAP transport management, client administration, and system refresh activities. Apply SAP system patches and kernel updates in coordination with the application and development teams. Maintain and optimize HANA database environments, ensuring data integrity and performance optimization. Monitor and ensure the security of the SAP landscape, including system audits, patch management, and compliance checks. Troubleshoot SAP-related issues and provide solutions to users and technical teams as needed. Develop and maintain documentation for system configurations, processes, and procedures. Work closely with infrastructure, networking, and security teams to align SAP system requirements with organizational IT standards. Ensure business continuity by managing backups, disaster recovery plans, and high availability strategies for SAP systems.  Requirements  5+ years of experience in SAP Basis administration, including expertise in HANA database administration is mandatory. Experience with SAP system installations, configurations, upgrades, and patch management. Hands-on experience with HANA database administration (e.g., backups, monitoring, tuning). SAP Basis or HANA certification. Knowledge of SAP security best practices and experience in SAP security audits. if above skills match with your profile, kindly send your updated resume ASAP. name: Arnela Tolic
position: Lawyer (Immigration/Employment Law)| Accredited NMAS Mediator| CPD Lecturer| Business Coach ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ«
text: Understanding the Subclass 186 Visa and Sponsoring an Accountant: The Caveats  The Subclass 186 visa allows Australian businesses to nominate skilled workers to fill roles that cannot be sourced locally.  It has three streams: Temporary Residence Transition (TRT) Stream â€“ For workers who have held a Temporary Skill Shortage (Subclass 482) visa for at least three years. Direct Entry (DE) Stream â€“ For workers who meet the skills assessment and work experience requirements.  Labour Agreement Stream â€“ For employers operating under a labour agreement with the Australian Government. For accountants, the DE and TRT streams are the most commonly used.  Accountants are on the Medium and Long-term Strategic Skills List (MLTSSL), making them eligible for the Subclass 186 visa. However, caveats apply to ensure the role meets genuine labour market needs.  Key Caveats- A must to meet  The sponsoring business must not have an annual turnover of less than AUD 1 million.  The business must employ at least five full-time employees (excluding family members).  The position is a clerical, bookkeeper or accounting clerk position.  Genuine Position Requirement The position must align with the needs of the business and not be created solely to facilitate a visa application. Employers must provide evidence such as organizational charts, financial reports, or proof of current staffing shortages to substantiate this.   Salary Thresholds The nominated accountant must be paid at least the Annual Market Salary Rate (AMSR) to ensure the role aligns with Australian employment standards.  Meeting the Skills and Qualifications Criteria The nominated accountant must: Hold qualifications equivalent to an Australian bachelorâ€™s degree in accounting. Provide a skills assessment from a recognized authority, such as CPA Australia, Chartered Accountants Australia and New Zealand (CA ANZ), or the Institute of Public Accountants (IPA).  Have a minimum of three years of post-qualification experience for the DE stream.  Common Challenges for Employers Proving Genuine Need Employers often struggle to demonstrate that hiring an overseas accountant is essential. A robust business case with data and documentation can mitigate this risk.  Navigating Caveats Businesses with fewer than five full-time employees or turnover under AUD 1 million may face additional scrutiny. Engaging migration professionals early can help navigate these challenges.  Tips for a Successful Nomination Plan Ahead: Understand the visa requirements and align them with your hiring strategy.  Engage Experts: Seek advice from migration agents or lawyers experienced in Subclass 186 visa nominations. Maintain Compliance: Ensure your business meets all regulatory and salary obligations.  Document Thoroughly: Prepare strong evidence to support your application, including detailed job descriptions, financial reports, and organizational structures.

name: Aurelia Legal Pty Ltd
text: Every week, countless women worldwide endure the devastating consequences of gender-based violence.  As of 2024, this global crisis persists, with millions of lives impacted. On this International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women, we stand in solidarity with survivors and honor the lives tragically lost.  Today marks the beginning of 16 days of activism to end violence against women and girls. Together, we advocate for urgent reformsâ€”stronger protections, increased funding for support services, and widespread education to foster behavioral change.  Aurelia Legal stands against all forms of family and domestic violence. name: Allhouse.co.nz
text: ğŸŒŸ From Ancient History to Allhouse Hustler    Hi, Iâ€™m Olly ğŸ‘‹ and hereâ€™s my story.  After graduating from the University of Liverpool with a degree in History and Ancient History (yep, the classics ğŸº), I wasnâ€™t exactly sure what I wanted to do.  But I knew one thingâ€”I love people and storytelling, so sales and marketing felt like a solid direction.  Fast forward a bit, and there I was, flying 22 hours from Scotland to New Zealand, ready to take on the unknown. What could possibly go wrong, right?  Turns out, I landed at Allhouse, where the vibe was very much sink or swim.  Day 1? I was handed a pile of scripts and told to go for it. No experience, no clueâ€”just a room, a phone, and a whole lot of hope. ğŸ˜…  Fast forward six months, and let me tell you, itâ€™s been a ride: âœ… Iâ€™ve gone from no experience to crushing cold calls. âœ… Iâ€™ve built some unreal client relationships. âœ… Iâ€™ve discovered skills I didnâ€™t know I had (and yes, talking non-stop is one of them).  Allhouse has given me the space to grow, fail, and try again, and honestly, I wouldnâ€™t trade it for anything. The â€œwork hard, play hardâ€ culture here has made every day an adventure.  Oh, and the big news? My internship just turned into a permanent gig, and Iâ€™ve extended my visa to stick around.  So if youâ€™re in property management or the rental market, expect to hear from meâ€”Iâ€™m here to help and probably share a few stories along the way. name: Sher-li Torrey
position: Founder, Mums@Work (Singapore) | Co-Founder, Career Navigators SG | Project-Creator, Singapore:40-over-40 | LinkedIn Top Voices in Gender Equity | Founder, Return-to-Work Japan
text: It all started when Toyin O. reached out to ask if Deborah Yuen & I would be open to supporting a back-to-work event in Tokyo, Japan. We were and so it happened! Last Friday, we partnered Visa to run â€œReturn to Work Japan Symposiumâ€, welcoming 50 ladies in Tokyo, who had taken a break / detoured career path due to caring for their families. With the support of Visa andJapan, the event featured a panel sharing, group coaching and networking with employers from ,,,,,&, together with  I am a firm believer that women empowerment is not about telling woman to be brave and speak up. Strength comes from within and from receiving positive affirmation from others. Most of all strength comes from knowing you are not alone.  From the get-go, the opening address by, sponsor of Inclusion & diversity in Visa Japan set the tone for the session. His candid story of a friend who had returned to work, embracing a different career, after more than a decade looking after family - inspired the women in the audience.  The awesome panelists in the panel session (,,,,) shared authentically about their own experience as a working mum and also from the HR perspective. As an attendee tearfully shared with us- "I am so moved by their open sharing. It makes me realise that as mothers, we are all struggling to integrate work and family, regardless of our background, experience or even our job rank at work. We are all human. "  LinkedInâ€™s 15 coaches volunteered to give small groups career guidance to the ladies. Having&share specific ways they got back to work, andtalk about how LinkedIn is used - was a great way to introduce personal branding. This segment saw the ladies come alive as everyone shared their experiences, challenges and solutions on moving forward.  Much gratitude to all the employer reps who came forward readily to support the ladies at the Networking Session - through your advice, sharing and guidance provided to the ladies.  Super thankful to Kyoko,,, and the entire VISA Japan team for putting in so much work to bring this project to fruition. We are excited for the many female attendees who came for the session - and looking forward to even more female empowering events in Japan soon.  å…ˆé€±ã®é‡‘æ›œæ—¥ã€Visaã¨ææºã—ã¦ã€ŒReturn to Work Japan Symposiumã€ã‚’é–‹å‚¬ã—ã€å®¶æ—ã®ä»‹è­·ã®ãŸã‚ã«ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ‘ã‚¹ã‚’ä¸­æ–­/è¿‚å›ã—ãŸæ±äº¬ã®å¥³æ€§50äººã‚’è¿ãˆã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ LinkedIn Japanã®å”åŠ›ã®ã‚‚ã¨ã€ãƒ‘ãƒãƒ«ãƒ‡ã‚£ã‚¹ã‚«ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã€ã‚°ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ—ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ã‚°ã€ã•ã¾ã–ã¾ãªä¼æ¥­ã®é›‡ç”¨è€…ã¨ã®ãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ãŒè¡Œã‚ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ ã“ã®ã‚¤ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒˆãŒå‚åŠ è€…ã«ä¸ãˆãŸå½±éŸ¿ã‚’è¦‹ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒã§ãã¦ã€æœ¬å½“ã«ç´ æ™´ã‚‰ã—ã‹ã£ãŸã§ã™ã€‚  ç§ã¯ã€å¥³æ€§ã®ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒ‘ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆã¨ã¯ã€å¥³æ€§ã«å‹‡æ°—ã‚’å‡ºã—ã¦å£°ã‚’ä¸Šã’ã‚‹ã‚ˆã†ã«è¨€ã†ã“ã¨ã§ã¯ãªã„ã¨å›ºãä¿¡ã˜ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚å¼·ã•ã¯ã€å†…é¢ã‹ã‚‰ã€ãã—ã¦ä»–è€…ã‹ã‚‰è‚¯å®šã‚’å—ã‘ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‹ã‚‰ç”Ÿã¾ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚ä½•ã‚ˆã‚Šã‚‚ã€å¼·ã•ã¯è‡ªåˆ†ãŒä¸€äººã§ã¯ãªã„ã¨çŸ¥ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã‹ã‚‰ç”Ÿã¾ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚ è¿‘ã„ã†ã¡ã«ã€æ±äº¬ã§ã‚‚åŒæ§˜ã®ã‚¤ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒˆã‚’é–‹å‚¬ã—ãŸã„ã¨è€ƒãˆã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

text: Global Debit Card Issuance Benefits to Clients and Platform Members  Our Platforms integrates global brand debit card issuance to our clients and platform members. Offering digital and physical debit cards to redeem their DGT's gives them the ability to make payments and withdraw money from ATM's anywhere in world. This brings several significant advantages, further enhancing the utility and appeal of these tokens:  Enhanced Accessibility  â€¢ Immediate Spending Power: Members can directly convert their digital gold tokens into fiat currency and use them for daily transactions, just like any regular debit card. â€¢ Global Acceptance: These debit cards are often linked to major payment networks (e.g., Visa or Mastercard), allowing users to pay at millions of merchants worldwide.  Seamless Integration with Digital Gold  â€¢ Real-Time Conversion: Users can liquidate digital gold holdings instantly for payments, offering unparalleled liquidity compared to traditional gold investments. â€¢ Multi-Currency Support: Members can pay in local currencies while the platforms automatically convert the equivalent value from their digital gold balance.  Financial Inclusion  â€¢ Access for the Unbanked: Individuals in regions with limited banking infrastructure can use these cards to participate in global commerce, bridging the gap between digital assets and traditional financial systems. â€¢ Empowering Cross-Border Users: Global debit cards eliminate the need for expensive international wire transfers, benefiting users who rely on cross-border payments or remittances.  Increased Platform Engagement  â€¢ Customer Retention: Providing a debit card strengthens loyalty, as users are more likely to engage with the platforms for both investment and everyday spending. â€¢ Enhanced Convenience: Members benefit from a single platform that manages investments, payments, and transactions, reducing the need to switch between services.  Competitive Advantage  â€¢ Differentiation in the Market: Our Platforms offer global debit cards gaining a competitive edge by seamlessly integrating digital gold with everyday financial tools. â€¢ Brand Recognition: Issuing branded debit cards can strengthen our client platformâ€™s reputation and visibility in global markets.  By issuing global debit cards, our digital gold platforms bridge the gap between traditional financial systems and modern digital assets, making their services more user-friendly, inclusive, and practical for a wide range of consumers. This functionality not only increases adoption but also positions our platforms as leaders in the evolving financial ecosystem.

name: Cabinhas Leitores
text: Nos Ãºltimos dois dias o Cabinhas Leitores pode participar da Expo Favela CearÃ¡ 2024. Foi um momento potencialmente oportuno para expormos como a periferia pulsa para alÃ©m do empreendedorismo convencional (que visa o lucro), no nosso caso, o empreendedorismo social. No entanto, os reveses de nossa presenÃ§a foram de vÃ¡rias ordens.  Pudemos perceber, logo no primeiro dia, como os expositores selecionados tinham de o ser "favelados atuais", ou seja, se vocÃª fosse um caso de um ex-favelado que ascendeu socialmente (e, inclusive economicamente) contra todas as hipÃ³teses e estatÃ­sticas, vocÃª nÃ£o deveria lÃ¡ estar, que dirÃ¡ ser reconhecido pelo seu enraizamento e compromisso pela comunidade que te criou. Contudo, nÃ£o se engane, o palco (inclusive em seu sentido literal) da Expo nÃ£o o era para os tais "favelados atuais" (basta ver o rol de celebridades e autoridades escaladas para o evento).  Nossa localizaÃ§Ã£o no pavilhÃ£o desfavoreceu, sem qualquer pingo de dÃºvida, o afluxo de pessoas para o nosso stand, o qual era voltado para a parede, de costas para o espaÃ§o central e longe do palco principal.  Dos nossos dois vizinhos de stand, um deles nÃ£o compareceu em nenhum dia de Expo e o outro nÃ£o sÃ³ compareceu, mas foi de um companheirismo gigante, inesperado e bem-humorado: valeu!  Agradecemos a todos que se dispuseram a andar ao rincÃ£o do pavilhÃ£o para nos ceder sua atenÃ§Ã£o para compreender um pouco do nosso projeto social. Foram poucas mas valorosas visitas.  Igualmente agradecemos a prestatividade da produtora local, Lara, e da gestora da Escola de NegÃ³cios da Favela, Bruna nos dias que antecederam a prÃ³pria Expo.  Alguns de nossos cabinhas vieram Ã  Expo visitar nosso stand e curtirem a feira como um todo. Nesse quesito, a taxa de contentamento da garotada foi bastante positiva, muito da Expo lhes foram novidades excitantes.  Em tempo, o ZÃ© Maria, pilar fundamental do Cabinhas Leitores, mora desde 1969 na comunidade do Padre Andrade.  PS: falar em "favela" Ã© tabu, pois pessoas em diferentes graus de vulnerabilidade econÃ´mica e social nÃ£o se enxergam como favelados, dada toda a carga demeritÃ³ria da palavra.  [T.T.] [24.11.2024]

name: Regional Universities Network
text: The Regional Universities Network (RUN) in partnership with the Australian Technology Network of Universities (ATN Universities) and Innovative Research Universities (IRU) have issued a joint statement urging politicians to implement a principles-based solution to Australiaâ€™s international student visa processing problem.  Representing nearly twenty institutions, educating 120,000 onshore international students and nearly half a million domestic students, we: 1) strongly encourage Parliament to consider the remaining components of the ESOS Amendment Bill which focus on enhancing quality and integrity in the system, 2) take immediate action to address the current distorted system for visa processing, and 3) call for an open and collaborative partnership between all universities and government to develop a shared long-term strategy for international education.  We call for a student visa processing regime that is based on the principles of transparency, repeatability, and institutional equality â€“ ensuring that student visas are processed in the same manner for all public universities.  The shortcomings of the current visa processing regime are well known and both universities and students need transparency and equality in the processing of student visas.  Read the full statement here:

O grÃ¡fico mostra a temperatura saindo de 31Âº C (ambiente) e estabilizando em 37Âº C (temperatura desejada) apÃ³s algum tempo, controlada por um microcontrolador que ajusta a saÃ­da com base nos cÃ¡lculos do PID, acionando um circuito de potÃªncia para esquentar um resistor dentro da cÃ¢mera. name: Howard Brown, RCIC-IRB, MSc
position: Bilingual Corporate Immigration Consultant ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ | Immigration & Citizenship Law | Managing Director, Lignum Immigration Services Ltd. | FIU Miami | Queens Faculty of Law | Providing Real Immigration Solutions
text: One of my earliest consultations almost resulted in a misrepresentation finding.From the initial assessment, the file appeared idealâ€”nothing seemed suspicious. Fast forward to the final submission review, where I routinely ask statutory questions: â€œHave you ever been denied a visa for ANY country?â€ and â€œHave you ever been arrested?â€ These questions are often misunderstood or misrepresented. To my surprise, there was a prior infractionâ€”a critical detail conspicuously omitted earlier, despite my thorough background questions during consultation.  Had I submitted the application unaware of this, a finding of misrepresentation would have been inevitable. The client had answered â€œNoâ€ to the statutory questions. Intentional or not, this could have triggered a five-year ban from Canada and potentially tarnished my professional reputationâ€”an all-too-common accusation against immigration consultants these days. This experience highlighted the importance of due diligenceâ€”not only for the client but for my credibility as a practitioner.  This is where mens rea (intent) meets actus reus (the act). I learned these terms in the context of misrepresentation during my immigration law training. Misrepresentation can occur whenever false information is provided, regardless of intent.  Consider last yearâ€™s controversy involving 700 international students accused of using fraudulent documents for study permits. Some had secured permanent residence, while others were still in limbo. Public reaction echoed the Queen of Hearts from Alice in Wonderland: â€œOff with their heads!â€ Yet, the Minister of Immigration deferred the matter to the courts. Some students succeeded in judicial review, while others faced removal.  The doctrine of stare decisis (legal precedent) plays a key role here. Recent case law has narrowed the scope of the â€œinnocent mistakeâ€ defense, making it harder for applicants to claim ignorance in misrepresentation cases. Jurisprudence has affirmed that ignorance of the law is rarely excusable, though exceptions exist for genuine errors.  As immigration professionals, we navigate this evolving legal landscape daily. Of over 12,000 regulated practitioners, the majority of us work diligently, guided by ethics and law, to represent our clients effectively.  If we ask probing questions, itâ€™s not to pry but to ensure truthful and accurate representation. Misrepresentationâ€”intentional or notâ€”carries serious consequences. Trust us with the truth. Donâ€™t lieâ€”itâ€™s a gamble no one can afford.  Photo courtesy: Pavel Danilyuk

name: Elizabeth Le
text: Australia: Join us on Wednesday, 27 November to hear from Australian Department of Home Affairs and Jobs and Skills Australia for the latest scoop.   Register here:  Earlier this year, it was announced that the Government would reduce the work experience requirement for the Temporary Skill Shortage (TSS) visa from two years to one year starting 23 November 2024. Since no legislative instrument were released to amend the regulations, this change did not happen.  We expect the new Skills in Demand (SID) visa (replacing the TSS) will have a one-year work experience requirement and the release of the SID visa might be the reason for the delay in the TSS visa changes.  While no commencement date has been provided for the Skills in Demand and National Innovation Visa programs, the Department of Home Affairs have confirmed fact sheets and resources are currently being developed to assist understanding when they start.  Join us!

name: QT Advisory
text: Notice on Further Optimizing the Policy for Hungarian Citizens to Enter China  From 00:00 on November 30, 2024 to 24:00 on December 31, 2025 Beijing time, China will pilot a unilateral visa-free policy for Hungary, expanding the reasons for entry to include business, tourism, visiting relatives and friends, transit, and exchange visits, and the visa-free stay period will be extended to 30 days.

text: Panama Qualified Investor Visa Panama implemente the qualified investor visa with Executive Decree 722 of October 15, 2020, for citizens of countries are not in the Friendly Nations Visa Program. The Qualified Investor Visa provides applicants Panama permanent residency through a qualifying investment in Panama, including the following options:  Real Estate: Invest $500,000 in a property Real Estate projects in pre-sale: sign a purchase and sale contract for the sum of $300,000 or more Investment in the Panamanian Stock Market: Purchase securities through a qualified and licensed Panamanian brokerage firm, for $500,000 or more. Fixed term deposit in the Banking Sector: open a time deposit of $750,000 in a qualified Panamanian bank.

Pathway to an H1-B Visa: The waiver helps eligible students transition toward obtaining long-term work authorization, opening doors to an H1-B visa and broader career opportunities. Streamlined Work Authorization: Reduces barriers to temporary employment opportunities for eligible students, making it easier to gain experience and contribute meaningfully to industries in demand.  âœ¨ What This Means for You This is a critical opportunity for undocumented students to pursue professional goals without the fear of deportation or the challenges of prior restrictions. name: Sara T. Laca
text: Digital nomad visa in Panama, Republic of Panama The visa was created in 2021 to help remote workers stay in Panama while the country was experiencing a drop in tourism due to the pandemic. It's designed to encourage visitors to explore Panama's culture and natural beauty while also facilitating remote work.  Income tax benefits Both residents and non-residents are required to file taxes in Panama. But unlike other countries, residents and non-residents are only taxed on their Panama-earned income. Foreign-earned income is not taxed in Panama. If you work for an employer that withholds taxes, you do not need to file a tax return, and your taxes will be automatically withheld. But, if youâ€™re self-employed, have multiple jobs without income withheld, or have a more complicated tax situation, you must file a tax return. How much youâ€™ll pay in taxes depends on whether youâ€™re a resident or non-resident.

text: US Companies Cut Back H-1B Visa Sponsorships in 2024 In 2024, the United States Citizenship & Immigration Services data revealed a significant decrease in H-1B visa sponsorships by major U.S. companies. Despite Indian nationals continuing to lead H-1B applicant pool, several tech giants have scaled back their approvals, indicating a potential change in hiring preferences.  H-1B Visa: A Brief Overview  The H-1B visa program has long been a critical pathway for U.S. companies to hire foreign workers in specialized roles, particularly in the technology sector.  Indian nationals have historically been the primary beneficiaries of this program. However, the latest data suggests a growing trend of companies opting for alternative hiring strategies or prioritizing domestic talent.  Decline in H-1B Visa Sponsorships  The H-1B visa has traditionally been a crucial route for U.S. companies to hire foreign specialists, particularly from India. However, the 2024 data suggests a noticeable decline in the use of this visa. Many leading firms are now exploring alternative hiring strategies, focusing more on domestic talent and reducing dependency on international recruitment.   Top 10 H-1B Sponsors in 2024  Hereâ€™s a breakdown of the top 10 companies sponsoring H-1B visas in 2024, according to USCIS:  S. No. Company Name H-1B Approvals 2024 1 Amazon Com Services LLC 9,265 2 Infosys Limited 8,140 3 Cognizant Technology Solutions 6,321 4 Google LLC 5,364 5 Tata Consultancy Services Limited 5,274 6 Meta Platforms Inc 4,844 7 Microsoft Corporation 4,725 8 Apple Inc 3,873 9 HCL America Inc 2,953 10 IBM Corporation 2,906 Key Trends Impacting Sponsorship Numbers  Amazon remains the leading sponsor, but its H-1B approvals dropped from over 11,000 in 2023 to just above 9,000 in 2024. Indian IT firms like Infosys and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) experienced significant reductions in visa approvals, reflecting a shift in recruitment strategies. Almost all top 15 sponsors saw a decrease in visa approvals, hinting at broader trends in the U.S. job market and immigration policies. Impact of Reduced Visa Sponsorship  The reduction in H-1B visa sponsorships by top tech companies could have far-reaching implications:  Shift Towards Domestic Talent: Companies may increasingly focus on hiring & developing domestic talent to fill critical roles. Impact on Global Talent: The decline in H-1B visas could discourage skilled foreign workers from seeking opportunities in U.S. Potential Changes to Immigration Policies: The trend may influence future immigration policies & regulations. Broader Trends Observed in Fiscal Year 2024  The fiscal year 2024 (spanning October 1, 2023, to September 30, 2024) showed a consistent decrease in H-1B visa approvals across the board.  Analysts suggest that companies might be adapting to evolving economic conditions, regulatory changes, and geopolitical factors that affect international recruitment. REMAINING IN COMMENTS COLUMN BELOW. Please note

name: Meagan Kirchner, Esq.
text: ğŸ’¡ Considering sponsoring a worker from Mexico or Canada on an H-1B? Many U.S. companies, when unable to find qualified talent domestically, have traditionally turned to the H-1B visa to fill high-demand, specialized positions. Over the years, the H-1B visa has become essential in industries like technology, making it popular among companies from Silicon Valley to Wall Street. However, with the rising demand, limited visa quotas, and increased competition in the H-1B lottery, many businesses face significant barriers. The high costs and uncertainty associated with the lottery process have discouraged many potential employers.  For employers frustrated with the H-1B process, the TN visa presents a viable alternative. The TN visa is available exclusively to Mexican and Canadian professionals seeking U.S. employment in specific fields, typically requiring a bachelorâ€™s degree. Common eligible TN positions include engineers, accountants, scientists, computer systems analysts, architects, teachers, and medical professionals, offering a wide range of opportunities for specialized roles across industries.  Here are some of the key advantages that make the TN visa an appealing option over H-1B for eligible employers:  * No Annual Cap: Unlike the H-1B program, which has a strict annual quota, the TN visa does not have a limit on the number of visas issued. This means qualified professionals can apply for TN status year-round without worrying about a lottery system.  *Faster Approval Process: The TN visa offers a faster, more streamlined process than H-1B.  * Unlimited Renewals: While H-1B visas have a six-year cap, the TN visa can be renewed indefinitely, allowing employers to keep skilled employees for the long term without the time restrictions of other visa categories.  *Greater Flexibility in Employment Terms: The TN program is comparatively flexible, giving employers more freedom to define and negotiate terms, including compensation and benefits. This flexibility makes it easier to tailor employment conditions to the needs of both the employer and employee.  Due to these benefits, interest in the TN program has surged, especially among businesses seeking STEM talent. Although limited to Mexican and Canadian professionals, many companies find the program beneficial, particularly when hiring individuals with Spanish language skills to support a predominantly Spanish-speaking workforce.  At Kirchner Law, we have witnessed the rising demand for the TN program firsthand. For businesses considering H-1B sponsorship for Mexican or Canadian professionals, or struggling to fill a skilled position, the TN visa is well worth exploring as a straightforward and efficient alternative. And if you need help finding candidates, we can connect you with trusted TN recruitment resources to support your hiring needs.

name: China Charmission Travel
text: Exciting News! Visa-free stay for up to 30 stays!  Chinese has decided to expand the scope of visa-free countries. Starting from November 30, 2024, to December 31, 2025, a trial visa free policy will be implemented for holders of ordinary passports from Bulgaria, Romania, Croatia, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Malta, Estonia, Latvia, and Japan.  In addition, (more importantly!) China has decided to synchronize the optimization of entry policies, including exchange visits as a reason for visa exemption, and extending the visa free stay period from the current 15 days to 30 days. Starting from November 30, 2024, holders of ordinary passports from the aforementioned 9 countries, along with 38 other visa-free countries, coming to China for business, tourism, visiting relatives and friends, exchange visits, or transit for no more than 30 days, can enter without a visa.  A brief summary of China's comprehensive and unilateral visa-free policies as of November 22, 2024:  China has achieved comprehensive visa-free agreements with 25 countries: Solomon Islands, Georgia, Thailand, Singapore, Maldives, Kazakhstan, Antigua and Barbuda, Albania, United Arab Emirates, Barbados, Bahamas, Belarus, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Dominica, Ecuador, Fiji, Grenada, Qatar, Mauritius, Serbia, Seychelles, San Marino, Suriname, Tonga, Armenia.  Unilateral visa-free policy for 38 countries: France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Spain, Malaysia, Switzerland, Ireland, Hungary, Austria, Belgium, Luxembourg, Australia, New Zealand, Poland, Denmark, Portugal, Greece, Cyprus, Slovenia, South Korea, Finland, Slovakia, Monaco, Andorra, Liechtenstein, Denmark, Norway, Iceland, Bulgaria, Romania, Croatia, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Malta, Estonia, Latvia, Japan.

name: Lucy Magardichian
text: Great article about the coveted H-B visa. The current visa numbers are not adequate to retain talent. The article states that the 85,000 annual limit (65,000 plus the 20,000 exemption) equals only 0.05% of the U.S. labor force. According to USCIS, the agency received H-1B registrations for 442,000 unique beneficiaries for FY 2025, five times more than the 85,000 ceiling. That means USCIS, in effect, was forced to block 300,000 to 350,000 high-skilled foreign nationals from working in the United States in 2024 due to the annual limit under U.S. law.

name: Dreem Relocation
text: ğŸ¤ Finding Referees for Your O-1 / EB-1A Visa Recommendation Letters ğŸ“©  Obtaining both O-1 and EB-1A visas requires demonstrating extraordinary ability in your field. Strong recommendation letters are crucial for a successful application. Aim for 5-6 letters from respected professionals who can attest to your achievements and expertise. Quality matters more than quantity. A prominent expert's letter holds more weight than multiple letters from colleagues or clients.  Here's how to find suitable referees:  1ï¸âƒ£ Leverage Your Professional Network: Start with coworkers, employers, subordinates, and freelancers. Even competitors can be valuable if you've collaborated or competed  2ï¸âƒ£ Review Your Contact List: Your phone contacts or business cards might hold hidden opportunities. Don't overlook past connections  3ï¸âƒ£ Ask Colleagues for Referrals: If your direct network lacks ideal candidates, ask colleagues for introductions to influential figures. Consider former advisors, supervisors, or clients  4ï¸âƒ£ Consider Critics and Partners: Professionals you've worked with, whether critics or collaborators, might have valuable connections. Their feedback can demonstrate the depth of your contributions  5ï¸âƒ£ Utilize LinkedIn: Create a detailed LinkedIn profile highlighting your accomplishments. Consider upgrading to premium for expanded reach  6ï¸âƒ£ Explore Google Scholar or Other Indexes: If your work has been cited, reach out to those who cited it. They are experts in their field and can provide strong recommendations  7ï¸âƒ£ Leverage Trade Unions or Professional Associations: These organizations often have lists of prominent members who can provide letters of support  Building Your List:  â€” Identify Potential Referees: Compile a list with their names, positions, and contact details â€” Reach Out: Request a recommendation letter, explaining why their input is valuable and how it can strengthen your application  ğŸ§  Remember: Many respected professionals are willing to support talented individuals. A strong recommendation letter can significantly enhance your O-1 / EB-1A visa application.

name: Michelle Abeckjerr
text: In recent years, Iâ€™ve met with many individuals who entered the United States on a tourist visa and later filed asylum claims as a way to remain in the country and obtain work authorization. This trend has become particularly common among Argentine nationals. While it may seem like a temporary solution, I strongly advise against it.  The consequences of filing a frivolous asylum claim include permanent ineligibility for any future immigration benefits. Additionally, once an asylum claim is filed (and you are no longer maintaining a non-immigrant status), transitioning to another type of statusâ€”such as an O-1 visa for extraordinary ability, a student visa, or any other type of nonimmigrant statusâ€”is no longer possible.  Unfortunately, many of these individuals initially worked with "notarios" or form fillers who failed to explain the long-term implications of their actions. If youâ€™re considering your immigration options, PLEASE seek informed legal advice. Itâ€™s incredibly disheartening to have consultations where I must tell a client that their case is essentially a ticking time bomb, likely leading to denial by an immigration judge.

name: digital x
position: Student at University of South Asia
text: Ending birthright citizenship has always been President-elect Donald Trumpâ€™s plan â€” ensnared in controversies as this arises from the Constitutionâ€™s 14th Amendment. After he won the election, a claim went viral that his youngest son Barron Trump will also be not considered a US citizen under his policy as Melania Trump became a US citizen three months after Barronâ€™s birth. The 14th Amendment granted citizenship to all persons â€œborn or naturalized in the United Statesâ€ including formerly enslaved people and has been interpreted to apply whether or not parents were in the country legally. But the claim regarding Barron is fake as Barronâ€™s father Donald Trump was a lawful permanent resident when Barron was born and Donald Trumpâ€™s executive order planned for the first day of his second term in office requires at least one parent to be an American citizen or lawful permanent resident for their children to become automatic US citizens. Was Melania not a US citizen before Barronâ€™s birth?  Melania came to the US in 1996 for modelling work. Melania and Donald Trump got married in 2005 and Barron Trump was born in March 2006. Melania became a citizen of the United States in July 2006. So it is true that Melania was not a US citizen when Barron was born.But Melania Trump was not an illegal resident either. She received an Einstein visa in 2001. Barron is a US citizen and Trumpâ€™s immigration policy wonâ€™t impact him  Trump said his order on birthright citizenship would not be retroactive. It will impact only the children born after it takes effect. Also, if one parent is a green card holder, then the child becomes a US citizen. Barron Trump has remained under the limelight this election campaign because he made his debut in his fatherâ€™s campaign and also advised him on which podcasts to go to reach the maximum young audience. This was also the first time Barron voted.    barron-trump-melania-trump-is-barron-trump-not-a-us-citizen-under-donalds-immigration-plan-claim-viral-on-social-media

name: Blumefy
text: ğ—¡ğ—¼ğ˜ ğ—”ğ—¹ğ—¹ ğ—¨.ğ—¦. ğ—ªğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—¸ ğ—©ğ—¶ğ˜€ğ—®ğ˜€ ğ—”ğ—¿ğ—² ğ—–ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—®ğ˜ğ—²ğ—± ğ—˜ğ—¾ğ˜‚ğ—®ğ—¹â€”ğ—ªğ—µğ—¶ğ—°ğ—µ ğ—¢ğ—»ğ—² ğ—™ğ—¶ğ˜ğ˜€ ğ—¬ğ—¼ğ˜‚ ğ—•ğ—²ğ˜€ğ˜?  Choosing the right U.S. work visa can shape your career, family life, and long-term opportunities.  With so many options, itâ€™s easy to feel lostâ€”but donâ€™t worry, weâ€™ve simplified it for you. Here's an overview of three popular visas, each with its unique strengths and challenges:  1. H-1B Visa: This is the most common starting point  Pros: -Lower entry requirements compared to other visas. -Spouses can work under H-4 EAD. -A potential pathway to a Green Card.  Cons: -Lottery-based system with low success rates (~20-30%). -Tied to your employer, limiting flexibility. -Restrictions on starting your own business.  2. L-1 Visa: This is for Intra-Company transfers  Pros: -No lotteryâ€”streamlined application process. -Spouse gets immediate work authorization. -Faster Green Card via the EB-1C category.  Cons: -Only available for specific roles like managers or specialized professionals. -Limited ability to switch employers.  3. O-1 Visa: This is for exceptional talents  Pros: -No lottery or annual capâ€”apply anytime. -Renewable indefinitely. -Perfect for entrepreneurs and foundersâ€”no salary minimums.  Cons: -Extremely high qualification standards. -Expensiveâ€”legal fees can exceed $10,000. -Spouses under the O-3 visa cannot work.  Each visa has unique trade-offs, and the best choice depends on your career goals, family priorities, and financial circumstances.  So, which path aligns with your goals? Our team at Blumefy can help!  Drop your questions in the comments or book a coaching session for tailored guidance. And donâ€™t forget to share this postâ€”it might just be the resource someone else needs!  Your journey to living and working in the U.S. starts here.

name: Vladyslav Galinskyi
position: Associate at Carter Lemon Camerons LLP
text: Permission letters issued under the Ukraine visa schemes will expire on 13 February 2025  Previously such permission letters have had no expiry date and therefore visa applicants who got it, could potentially use them to come to the UK within any period of time they wanted and needed to (be it within a 6-month period, a 1-year period or even longer).  From now on, the Home Office has amended the immigration rules and confirmed that such permission letters shall only be valid until 13 February 2025.  In practical terms, it means that those who have had their Ukraine visa scheme application submitted from outside the UK and approved, but who could not or did not want to come to the UK using that permission letter â€“ now have a limited time until 13 February 2025 to do so. name: Second Wind
text: Investing in a Troubled Business for an EB-5 Visa   Did you know that investing in a troubled business can be a path to your EB-5 visa? Hereâ€™s what you need to know!  What is a Troubled Business? A troubled business is one that has:  - Been in existence for at least two years. - Incurred a net loss during the 12- or 24-month period before the priority date on the immigrant investorâ€™s Form I-526. - The loss must be at least 20% of the businessâ€™s net worth before the loss.  Key Benefits for EB-5 Investors:  - Job Maintenance: Instead of creating 10 new jobs, you can rely on job maintenance. You must show that the number of existing employees is, or will be, no less than the pre-investment level for at least two years. ğŸ“‹âœ…  Why Consider a Troubled Business? Investing in a troubled business can be a strategic way to fulfill EB-5 requirements while helping to revive and grow a struggling enterprise.

name: Moronke Oladimeji
position: International Education Professional / QEAC / IEAA Associate Member
text: Was your Visa ever denied?  Receiving a visa rejection can be disheartening, but how you respond to this is very crucial. It's a deeply emotional experience, often leaving applicants feeling a mix of disappointment, frustration, and uncertainty.  Here are some common mistakes to avoid for future visa applications:  1) Don't panic or act impulsively. I have clients who discarded or tore visa refusal letters because they were upset. Itâ€™s natural to feel frustrated, but donâ€™t rush into decisions or vent publicly. You may likely need the letter for future applications.  2) Donâ€™t reapply immediately without understanding and addressing the reasons for the refusal. Many people believe that securing a visa is a matter of chance or luck. This is not true! A well-prepared application that meets the criteria has a much higher chance of approval than one filled with errors or missing information.  3 Donâ€™t provide false information. Attempting to improve your chances by falsifying documents or providing inaccurate information is a serious offense. It can lead to bans or legal consequences, making it harder to obtain a visa in the future. Always declare previous visa refusals, if you ever had them, either as a main applicant or a dependant or in a group application.  4) Donâ€™t overlook professional assistance. With diligence and the right guidance, you can improve your chances of approval. Seek advice from certified consultants to strengthen your reapplication. A professional will guide you on what to include in your new application and how to present it to Immigration authorities.  5) Donâ€™t lose hope: A rejection is not the end of the road. You can succeed on a second or third attempt after carefully addressing the issues. Stay determined and be focused. With the right support and preparation, you can turn this setback into a stepping stone for future success.

text: â€œCan you sponsor visas?â€ and â€œCan you sponsor a visa for me?â€ are, in my view, two very different questions.  Answering the first is straightforward:  Glassdoor can help you gauge potential salary ranges for the role youâ€™re targeting, while LinkedIn is useful for finding current employees who might be open to an informational chat. Together, these can give you a rough idea for the first question.  Broadly speaking, the first question is about gathering general information.  The second question, however, is more complex. It requires understanding the companyâ€™s stance on individual cases, which takes time and often isnâ€™t a straightforward yes or no when they first meet someone.  Unfortunately, I often see students mix up the two, directly asking HR the second question and receiving an ambiguous answer that offers little help.

text: Applying For American Visas In Mexico   There are nine U.S. consulates in Mexico.   To visit Mexico for U.S. visa application, foreigners need a Mexico Tourist Visa - Tourist Card.  Foreigners should wait for the Mexico visa to be processed after they submit their visa application at the Mexican Consulate abroad.  Citizens from the following countries do not need Mexico visa:  Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Singapore, Slovakia, Slovenia, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Trinidad and Tobago, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States and Uruguay.

text: Foreign-born doctors may also have the opportunity to apply for a permanent resident immigrant visa and Green Card through employment-based (EB) US visa programs (such as the EB-1 Visa or EB-2 Visa) or family sponsorship by an American citizen or US permanent resident or the Diversity Visa Lottery Program.  Yes, a foreign-trained doctor in Biochemistry from India can potentially qualify for an immigrant visa to the United States to establish an office, most likely through the EB-2 category of employment-based immigration, provided they can demonstrate exceptional ability in their field through research publications, awards, and other evidence of significant contributions to the field of biochemistry; they will also need to pass any necessary licensing exams required to practice in their desired state.  Key points to consider:  Visa category: The most likely pathway for a biochemistry doctor would be the EB-2 visa category, which is for individuals with advanced degrees and exceptional abilities in their field. Proof of exceptional ability: To qualify, the doctor would need to provide substantial evidence of their expertise, including peer-reviewed publications, presentations at major conferences, awards in the field, and significant research contributions. Labor certification: Depending on the specific circumstances, a labor certification may be required, which means a U.S. employer would need to demonstrate that there is a need for a foreign worker in the position. O-1 Visa option: If the doctor has achieved a high level of international recognition in their field, they may also be eligible for an O-1 visa, which is for individuals with extraordinary ability. State licensing requirements:  Even with an immigrant visa, the doctor will still need to pass the necessary licensing exams required by the State where they plan to practice.  What is E-2 Visa Category  An EB-2 visa is an employment-based visa ........ REMAINING POST IN COMMENTS

But, he has a major concern. He messaged me this weekend,  Aditi, I didnâ€™t attend IIT or IIM.  I'm from a middle-class family in a small town in India Even coming to the US was a struggle  Do I have even a 10% chance for EB1?  What made matters worse is that Ganesh looked up the profiles of folks who got their Einstein Visas on  That did not help his anxiety at all.  After observing all their profiles  Ganesh was convinced that he had to be a certain type of person to get EB1  Someone who is:  - Extremely extroverted - Ultra-confident speaking on stages - A Braniac with a 1000 patents & a 100 books  Ganesh is none of this. name: Layovers.Amsterdam
text: Exploring Amsterdam on a Short Visit: A Guide for US and Canadian Travelers  Amsterdam, with its iconic canals, world-class art, and vibrant neighborhoods, is a perfect destination to explore, even if youâ€™re short on time during a layover, stopover, or cruise visit. For US and Canadian citizens, travel to the Netherlands is straightforward, visa-free, and full of opportunities for cultural immersion.  No Visa Required As a US or Canadian traveler, you can enjoy a visa-free visit to Amsterdam for up to 90 days within a 180-day period. This makes it easy to explore the cityâ€™s treasures without dealing with lengthy paperwork.  Essential Travel Requirements While no visa is needed, there are a few important requirements:  Passport Validity: Ensure your passport is valid for at least three months beyond your planned departure from the Schengen Area.  Supporting Documents: Be prepared to show proof of accommodation, a return or onward ticket, and evidence of sufficient funds to cover your stay.  Why Travel Insurance is a Smart Choice Even for short visits, comprehensive travel insurance is highly recommended. It provides peace of mind in case of unexpected delays, health issues, or other travel hiccups.  Amsterdamâ€™s charm is best experienced in any amount of time you have. With visa-free access and simple entry requirements, itâ€™s a must-see destination for any traveler passing through Europe.

name: Karol D.
position: Business Immigration Supervisor @ Fragomen | Employment-Based Immigration and Program Management | Change Management | MBA in HR Management | Global Mobility Specialist
text: Understanding Who Can and Who Canâ€™t Be Deported in 2025  The 2024 U.S. presidential election has reignited the national debate on immigration, with renewed pledges to deport millions of undocumented immigrants. However, immigration law is intricate, and deportation isnâ€™t a straightforward process for every non-citizen.  âš«ï¸ Who Can Be Deported?  â–ªï¸Undocumented Immigrants: This group includes those who entered the U.S. without authorization or overstayed a visa. While there are protections for certain individuals, this population generally faces the greatest risk of removal. â–ªï¸Criminal Offenders: Non-citizens convicted of serious crimes, including aggravated felonies, drug offenses, and crimes involving moral turpitude, are often prioritized. U.S. immigration law is stringent on removing individuals with specific criminal backgrounds. â–ªï¸Non-Immigrants in Violation of Their Status: Those on student, work, or tourist visas who fail to comply with visa conditions (e.g., working without authorization) may be placed in removal proceedings. â–ªï¸Non-Citizens Whoâ€™ve Committed Immigration Fraud: Individuals who provide false information on immigration applications or commit document fraud are at risk for deportation, as immigration agencies consider fraud a serious violation. â–ªï¸Those Who Pose National Security Threats: Individuals associated with terrorism or espionage, or who engage in activities threatening U.S. security, face immediate removal actions.  âšªï¸ Who Canâ€™t Be Deported?  â–«ï¸U.S. Citizens: While it may seem obvious, U.S. citizens are entirely protected from deportation, regardless of whether they were born in the U.S. or acquired citizenship through naturalization. â–«ï¸Legal Permanent Residents (LPRs) with Strong Ties: While green card holders can be deported for serious crimes, those with a clean record and strong community and family ties are less likely to face deportation. â–«ï¸Asylum Seekers and Refugees with Valid Status: Individuals granted asylum or refugee status are protected from deportation unless they commit certain crimes or have their status revoked. â–«ï¸Protected Groups (DACA, TPS): Certain programs like Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) and Temporary Protected Status (TPS) offer temporary protection. However, these protections are vulnerable to policy changes and legal challenges. â–«ï¸Non-Citizens Married to U.S. Citizens or with U.S.-Citizen Children: While not absolute protection, strong family ties can sometimes weigh in favor of individuals facing deportation, especially if they demonstrate good moral character and contribute positively to society.  The Complexities of Enforcement  Deportation is not always immediate or guaranteed. Due process rights allow individuals to present their case before an immigration judge. In this era of heightened immigration scrutiny, knowing your rights and staying informed about policy changes is essential for anyone affected by these potential shifts.

text: When you are going to invest in a U.S. company, there are certain procedures to follow both domestically and abroad in order to obtain an E-2 visa. A detailed explanation of the steps involved in getting an E-2 visa, specifically in the United States, is given here:  Who is eligible for an E-2 visa? Citizens of Treaty Countries like Bangladesh.  You must be a citizen of a treaty country that has an E-2 agreement with the United States. Investors and Essential Workers.  Investors: Investors who invest a substantial amount in a United States business. It is also applicable under the E-2 category for employees who will be employed in an executive or supervisory capacity, will have managerial duties, or possess special skills that are indispensable to the operation of the business.   Key Eligibility Criteria: 1. Ownership and Control: Investors need to be in possession of a significant managerial role or at least 50% of the company.  2. Ongoing Operations: Throughout the E-2 status, the company must continue to be active and run.  3. Dependents: E-2 dependent status may also be applied for by spouses and unmarried children under 21. Spouses can request permission to work.  To know more details or make an appointment at our USA office, call: 01941-571000, 01820-033221, 02226601299.

name: Glenn R. Morales Dalrymple
position: U.S. Consular Affairs Attorney at Law. Washington DC.St. Matthew's Cathedral 64. Senior Loyola. Red Mass, Faith & Justice. Clan DalrympleğŸ´ó §ó ¢ó ³ó £ó ´ó ¿.
text: How could an American Consulate adjudicate a U.S. B1B2 nonimmigrant visa to a foreign applicant who was: 1) arrested while visiting the United States previously or 2) convicted in other country for a small crime of moralturpitude, but the charges were dismissed in the U.S. or abroad?  Crimes of moral turpitude have visa - consular consequences for foreign citizens.  Some U.S. States or foreign countries grand theft or petty theft are crimes of moral turpitude at Consular level and there are exceptions. Particular small crimes in the U.S. or abroad are not a crime of moral turpitude.  As per INA 212(a)(2)(A)(i)(1) and as per experiences in the consular window, , a foreign citizen who was convicted of a crime of moral turpitude in the United States or abroad is subject to a U.S. visa refusal.  There are nonimmigrant - immigrant waivers for those found inadmissible under INA 212(a)(2)(A)(i)(1) and need to remain eligible for visa - admission to the United States.

name: The Scheer Immigration Law Group
text: Preparing for a consular interview can seem overwhelming, especially when itâ€™s one of the final steps in the immigration process. Understanding the process, knowing what to expect, and preparing properly can help reduce stress and give you the confidence to succeed. This interview is an important meeting, so a thorough understanding and preparation will be helpful for both you and the consular officer. By following a checklist and keeping in mind some important tips, you can feel better prepared and increase your chances of a positive outcome. Below are steps and advice to help guide you through what to expect before, during, and after the consular interview. At, The Scheer Immigration Law Group, we are here to guide you through the legal process and help you navigate the complexities of your case.  Understanding the Purpose of a Consular Interview The consular interview is a meeting with a consular officer that helps them make a decision about your visa application. This interview typically takes place at a U.S. embassy or consulate in your home country and is an essential part of the visa approval process. Consular officers ask questions to confirm your identity, background, and reasons for seeking a visa to the United States. They may also look at your qualifications, whether you meet the visa requirements, and if you plan to follow U.S. immigration laws once you arrive. Being clear about the purpose of the interview helps you understand the kinds of questions they might ask and allows you to prepare appropriate answers that are honest and precise.  Gathering and Organizing Your Documents One of the most important steps is to gather all the required documents. Having your paperwork ready will help your interview go smoothly. These documents often include your passport, appointment confirmation, visa application confirmation, a photo that meets U.S. visa requirements, and any other documents required based on your visa type. For example, if youâ€™re applying for a family-based visa, you may need to provide birth certificates or marriage certificates. For work visas, you might need employment contracts or letters from your employer. Having a checklist of all required documents and going through it carefully will help you ensure you are well-prepared. Itâ€™s important to organize these documents neatly, preferably in a folder or file, so they are easy to access during the interview.  To Learn More Please Click Our Link:

name: Naimeesha Murthy
position: Product Management & GTM Strategy Lead | Founder, Creator & Community Builder | Board Member & EB1A Recipient (Ft. in Forbes, Business Insider, BuiltIn)
text: 7 Must-Know FAQs to Make Your EB1A Publications Stand Out    Happy Friday! Keeping the EB1A FAQ series going. If youâ€™re working on your EB1A visa, especially in Product Management or Tech, having the right publications can really boost your application. Here are some FAQs to help you showcase them and stand out!  1. What types of publications help with an EB1A application? Focus on major media, professional journals, trade publications, and academic outlets. The goal is to show that your work is widely respected and recognized in your field.  2. Do I need a lot of citations for my publications to count? Not necessarily! While citations can help, itâ€™s more about the impact of your work. Even if citations are minimal, as long as your work is being recognized and used in your field, it can make a strong case.  3. How many publications should I aim for? USCIS values quality over quantity, so make sure each publication demonstrates relevance and significance. A solid target is between 5-10 impactful publications.  4. Does it matter if itâ€™s online or in print? Both work, but print publications are sometimes easier to verify because you can show hard numbers on circulation. If your work is online, ensure viewership is organic and substantial. USCIS may look closer at online metrics.  5. Are conference papers a good idea? Absolutely! Presenting at peer-reviewed conferences shows active contribution to your field and adds credibility to your expertise.  6. Do trade journals or industry magazines count? Yes! Trade journals are industry-specific and can show that youâ€™re respected by professionals in your area, which adds weight to your application.  7. Why is major media coverage important? Major media proves that your work is respected by a larger audience. It gives your EB1A application an extra boost by showing broad recognition.  Remember! Each publication you showcase should highlight your impact and expertise in the field. With these tips, youâ€™re ready to make your EB1A publications stand out. Good luck!  If you have any questions - feel free to grab a 1x1 with me. Link in comments below. __

name: Law Firm EVCHATOV & PARTNERS
text: Foreigners entering Russia will be required to submit biometrics from December 1, 2024. The experiment on submitting biometrics consists of 2 stages. At the 1st stage, foreigners entering through the international airports of Moscow (Domodedovo, Sheremetyevo, Vnukovo) and the Moscow region (Zhukovsky), as well as through the automobile checkpoint in the Orenburg region (Mastakovo), will submit biometrics (photo and fingerprints) at checkpoints. In the future, when applying to the Multifunctional Migration Center of Moscow, they will undergo genomic registration and receive an electronic card of a foreign citizen. At the 2nd stage, from June 30, 2025, foreigners entering visa-free through any checkpoint will submit biometrics in advance through the EBS mobile application and submit an application with their data and information about the purpose of the visit through the Gosuslugi application. In the future, an electronic card with a QR code will be used to identify foreigners in Russia. According to Government Resolution No. 1510 of 07.11.2024, the experiment will last until June 30, 2026 and will not affect some foreigners: â€¢ Citizens of Belarus, â€¢ Children under 6 years of age, â€¢ Diplomats, â€¢ Employees of diplomatic missions and consular offices of foreign states, international organizations accredited in the Russian Federation and their representative offices, and members of their families.  Designed by Freepik
