position: Registered Migration Agent at S&C Migration and Visa Specialists
text: Understanding ANZSCO Codes and Their Importance in Australian Migration   For anyone considering skilled migration to Australia, the ANZSCO code is a critical factor in your application process. Hereâ€™s why:  1. Visa Eligibility: Your occupation must be listed on Australia's Skilled Occupation List (SOL), which is determined by your ANZSCO code.  2. Skills Assessment: The relevant assessing authority uses your ANZSCO code to evaluate whether your qualifications meet Australian standards.  3. Points Calculation: Your ANZSCO code is essential for the points system, which determines your eligibility for a skilled visa and your chances of receiving an invitation to apply.  Itâ€™s crucial to ensure your occupation matches the correct ANZSCO code to avoid any delays or complications in your visa process.  For expert guidance on ANZSCO codes and the skilled migration process, contact S&C Migration and Visa Specialists! name: ZAAF Law & Immigration
text: The EB-5 visa program has several mandatory requirements for investors, including:  1. Investment Amount: â€¢ The minimum investment is $1.05 million for a standard EB-5 investment. â€¢ If the investment is in a Targeted Employment Area (TEA) â€” a rural or high-unemployment area â€” the minimum investment is reduced to $800,000. 2. Job Creation: â€¢ The investment must create at least 10 full-time jobs for U.S. workers within two years of the investorâ€™s entry into the U.S. as a conditional permanent resident. â€¢ These jobs must be full-time positions (35+ hours per week) and available to U.S. citizens, lawful permanent residents, or other authorized workers. 3. At-Risk Investment: â€¢ The investment funds must remain â€œat riskâ€ throughout the entire investment period, with no guarantees of return. This means there must be a chance of both profit and loss. 4. Source of Funds: â€¢ Investors must prove that their funds come from a lawful source. This could include income, sale of assets, gifts, or loans (as long as the loan is secured by the investorâ€™s assets). 5. Direct or Regional Center Investment: â€¢ Investors can choose to invest directly in a business or through a USCIS-approved regional center. Regional centers can help meet job creation requirements by counting indirect job creation. 6. Compliance with the Business Plan: â€¢ A comprehensive business plan must be submitted, detailing how the investment will meet EB-5 requirements. If investing in a regional center project, this is usually provided by the center. 7. Application Process: â€¢ File Form I-526 (Immigrant Petition by Alien Investor) to initiate the EB-5 process. â€¢ After approval and obtaining conditional permanent residency, file Form I-829 to remove conditions and receive permanent residency after fulfilling EB-5 requirements.  Would you like more details on any specific part? Contact us at : 929-919-6969

position: Senior Counsel @ Waypoint Immigration USA | Immigration Law
text: Now more than ever, it's important to be educated about your immigration status.  Knowledge can be powerful.  Gather as many resources as you can, ask questions, and plan for both the short-term and long-term. And when in doubt, donâ€™t hesitate to get a second opinion.  For example, did you know that as an H-1B visa holder, your employer may be required by law to continue paying you the wage specified in the H-1B petition, even if you are laid off or not actively working? This requirement often continues through the petition period until there is a "bona fide" termination of the employment relationship.  If your employer terminates your employment, they likely need to follow these steps for it to be considered a bona fide termination:  ğŸ”¹ Notify you of your termination. ğŸ”¹ Notify USCIS of your termination. ğŸ”¹ Pay for your reasonable costs of return transportation.  Note, if you secure a new job and your new employer files another H-1B petition for you, this likely will be treated as an express termination of your previous employment, ending any further wage obligations of your prior employer.  Have questions about your H-1B or nonimmigrant status? Feel free to schedule a consultation using the link on my profile!

name: Badrinath Balavenkateshan
position: I Help Individuals & Companies Navigate UK Immigration | Director & Senior Immigration Consultant | Lawyer
text: ğŸš¨ Update: Introducing the No Time Limit Application for Legacy Document Holders  The UK has introduced a No Time Limit (NTL) application for individuals with indefinite leave to enter or remain, who cannot currently register for a UKVI account to access the new digital eVisa system.  Hereâ€™s what you need to know:  ğŸ“Œ Who Should Apply?  This application is relevant for those holding a *legacy document* that previously allowed entry into the UK without issues. With the move to digital immigration records, legacy documents will no longer be accepted for border entry, making it essential to apply for an NTL if you still hold one.  ğŸ“Œ Why Apply for an NTL?  The NTL application ensures your status is up-to-date in the UKâ€™s digital immigration system. Itâ€™s more than just confirming your status, it involves a review of your immigration record to verify that you still hold indefinite leave to enter or remain.  ğŸ“Œ Eligibility Criteria  You may be eligible to apply if: - You have indefinite leave to enter or remain (British and Irish citizens are not eligible). - Youâ€™re currently in the UK. - You can provide evidence of your identity and presence in the UK, such as official correspondence addressed to you. - Your indefinite leave hasnâ€™t been renounced or lapsed, and there are no grounds to revoke it. - You do not have any pending immigration applications.  ğŸ“Œ Required Documentation  Submit current or expired immigration documents, if available. If not, explain your circumstances and provide any supporting evidence to verify your status. The Home Office may check its records if you lack documentation.  ğŸ“Œ Processing Time and Travel Rights  NTL applications are free and aim to be processed within six months. While your application is under review, you may travel outside the Common Travel Area without your application being withdrawn.  ğŸ“Œ Alternative Options if Rejected  If your application is declined, you may explore other options, like a returning resident visa, if you've lost your indefinite leave.  For support with your No Time Limit application, or to check your eligibility, feel free to reach out to me!

name: Adaeze Victoria Akuneme (BSC,PGD)
text: Did you know that ancient Greeks believed eating beans would conjure up the souls of the dead?    In ancient Greek culture, beans were considered taboo due to the notion that they contained the spirits of the deceased. This superstition stemmed from the idea that beans resembled eggs, symbolizing birth and death.  Fast-forward to today, and Greece has transformed into a haven for:  Wine connoisseurs: Greece boasts some of the world's finest wines, with ancient vineyards and indigenous grape varieties.  Golden Visa seekers: Greece offers a residency program, granting non-EU citizens a Golden Visa in exchange for investing in Greek real estate.  What do you think about this remarkable transformation?  Share your thoughts on:  1. Unusual food taboos from history 2. Cultural significance of food in ancient civilizations 3. Fascinating food myths and legends 4. Greece's modern wine industry 5. Benefits of the Golden Visa program  Let's explore Greece's captivating past and vibrant present!

name: Bhatia Consultancy Services
text: How to Use an SOP Sample for an Australia Student Visa Application Referring to a sample SOP for an Australian student visa can help clarify how to structure and write your own SOP. However, following some guidelines can enhance your understanding of how to effectively use the sample. Understand the Structure: Carefully examine the structure of the sample SOP. Note the Word and Page Limits: Pay attention to word count and page requirements. Analyze Vocabulary and Sentence Patterns: Observe the choice of words and sentence flow. Use the Tone and Style as a Guide: Let the tone and writing style inform your own approach. Break Down Each Section: Analyze each part of the sample SOP and use it as a model for drafting your own. Importance of an SOP for an Australian Student Visa Why is an SOP essential for an Australian student visa? An SOP plays a crucial role in the visa application process because: It can increase your likelihood of securing a visa. It helps visa officers assess the sincerity and honesty of your application. It provides insight into your potential and academic goals. A well-crafted SOP effectively communicates your intentions and background to the visa officials. It offers an understanding of your identity, aspirations, and motivations. How Does an SOP for an Australian Student Visa Differ from Other Countries? SOPs for student visas vary depending on the destination country. Hereâ€™s what sets Australiaâ€™s SOP apart: The SOP for Australia is written in a clear, structured format. While some countries require video essays, Australia typically prefers text-based SOPs. Unlike many countries where SOPs are mandatory for all programs, Australian universities may require SOPs only for certain disciplines, such as arts, business, and education. The Australian SOP emphasizes factual information over storytelling. It seeks evidence of your accomplishments and potential. The Genuine Temporary Entrant (GTE) Requirement The Genuine Temporary Entrant (GTE) is a vital aspect of the Australian student visa application process. By understanding its purpose, criteria, and required documentation, applicants can better demonstrate their intent to study in Australia temporarily. Documenting GTE Intentions: To show genuine intentions, applicants must provide specific documents, such as: Statement of Purpose (SOP): A detailed statement outlining your motivation for studying in Australia, academic objectives, and career aspirations. Academic Records: Official transcripts and certificates from prior education. Financial Capacity: Proof of funds to cover tuition, living costs, and return travel. English Language Proficiency: Evidence of meeting language requirements for the chosen program. Health and Character Documents: Medical examination results and police clearance certificates.  For Details, Contact: Bhatia Consultancy Services  9478558488

text: The finance sector is highly regulated and is also governed by world-leading standards to ensure compliance, security and service. One of the main standards is EMV, but what is it? EMV stands for,andand is a global standard for interoperation of integrated circuit cards (also called IC cards or chip cards) and IC-card-capable point of sale (POS) terminals and automated teller machines (ATMs), for the purpose of authenticating credit and debit card transactions. It's crucial for fairness and equity to prevail in Australia's visa policies to uphold the commitment to global talent and diversity. Its time for a fair review that considers all stakeholders' interests. name: Fatima HASSOU
text: A simple guide to PCI compliance  Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards (PCI DSS) sets the minimum standard for data security. Hereâ€™s a step-by-step guide to maintaining compliance.  Since 2005, over 11 billion consumer records have been compromised from over 8,500 data breaches. These are the latest numbers from The Privacy Rights Clearinghouse, which reports on data breaches and security breaches impacting consumers dating back to 2005.  To improve the safety of consumer data and trust in the payment ecosystem, a minimum standard for data security was created. Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover, and JCB formed the Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council (PCI SSC) in 2006 to administer and manage security standards for companies that handle credit card data. Before the PCI SSC was established, these five credit card companies all had their own security standards programsâ€”each with roughly similar requirements and

text: Your visa approval depends on the countryâ€™s immigration policies.   (only partially true)    That doesnâ€™t mean policies donâ€™t matter.   It just means:   â†’ Policies set the framework, not the decision.  â†’ Individual applications still carry more weight.  â†’ Approval hinges on how strong your case is.   Iâ€™ve seen many applicants get overwhelmed by the idea of strict immigration rules.   Here are 3 things to focus on instead:   1. Submit complete, accurate documentation.  2. Highlight your ties to your home country.  3. Clearly state the purpose of your visit.   Policies donâ€™t approve visasâ€”strong applications do.   Make yours count.   P.S. name: Be There Travel
text: As per the recent update from the US Embassy in India regarding significant changes to the visa appointment procedures, specifically for B-1/B-2 interview waiver appointments in New Delhi. This change aims to streamline the processing system for nonimmigrant visitor visas.  As you may know, B-1/B-2 visas allow individuals to temporarily enter the United States for business (B-1) or tourism/medical treatment (B-2). Applicants also have the option to apply for both (B-1/B-2), depending on their travel requirements.  Notably, the recent consolidation of interview waiver appointments exclusively in New Delhi marks a shift from the previous multiple location scheduling. This decision is intended to improve efficiency in Visa processing.  We are available to guide for the process and submission. You can feel free to reach us out in case of any further clarification.  Mail - Number - 7017915892

name: Rajshekar Tubachi
position: Founder and Educational Consultant @ Maven | Study Abroad, Workshop Facilitation
text: ğŸš¨ Breaking News: Opposition Blocks Proposed Cap on International Student Numbers in AustraliağŸš¨  The Australian government's recent proposal to cap international student numbers has hit a roadblock, with the opposition stepping in to halt the plan. This decision has significant implications for the education sector, economy, and international students themselves.  Key Points:  1. Economic Concerns: Critics have labeled the cap as "economic vandalism," warning of potential financial losses and job cuts within the sector. Universities could face a loss of AUD $4 billion due to declining enrolments and visa processing delays.  2. Sector Impact: The opposition argues that the proposed caps would not solve issues like housing shortages and cost of living pressures. Instead, they claim it could exacerbate these problems.  3. Visa and Migration: Ongoing visa processing challenges remain a significant hurdle for international students, impacting Australia's reputation as a top study destination.  4. Global Reputation: Maintaining Australia's standing in international education is crucial. Prolonged policy uncertainty could deter potential students and impact the country's cultural and economic landscape.  Expert Opinions:  - Dr. Peter Hendy and Vicki Thomson have emphasized the need for policies that enhance the sector's competitiveness and ensure stability.  ### Conclusion:  While the opposition's decision prevents immediate restrictions, it underscores the urgent need for a balanced and stable policy framework. The goal is to support the growth of Australia's international education sector while addressing migration and infrastructure challenges.  As we navigate these changes, collaboration between policymakers, educational institutions, and stakeholders is essential to maintain Australia's position as a leading destination for international students.  Let's connect and discuss the future of international education in Australia! ğŸŒ  ğŸ“š

name: Felipe S.

text: Aos javeiros de plantÃ£o, o artigo aborda um problema crÃ­tico de seguranÃ§a em aplicaÃ§Ãµes web Java, a vulnerabilidade conhecida como Missing-Owner-Check (MOC). Essa vulnerabilidade pode permitir acesso nÃ£o autorizado a dados sensÃ­veis dos usuÃ¡rios.  Os autores propÃµem uma nova abordagem, chamada MOCGuard, que visa identificar e analisar essas vulnerabilidades de forma eficaz. A abordagem MOCGuard adota uma anÃ¡lise centrada no banco de dados para detectar vulnerabilidades MOC, onde o processo Ã© dividido em duas fases principais:  AnÃ¡lise SemÃ¢ntica do Banco de Dados e VerificaÃ§Ã£o das Checagens de ProprietÃ¡rio. Na primeira abordagem, o MOCGuard identifica tabelas que armazenam informaÃ§Ãµes dos usuÃ¡rios e infere quais dados pertencem a esses usuÃ¡rios, essa anÃ¡lise garante que os dados sejam corretamente atribuÃ­dos aos seus respectivos proprietÃ¡rios.  JÃ¡ a segunda abordagem, apÃ³s identificar os dados pertencentes aos usuÃ¡rios, o MOCGuard examina se as checagens de proprietÃ¡rio estÃ£o implementadas corretamente tanto no nÃ­vel SQL quanto no nÃ­vel Java. Essa verificaÃ§Ã£o garante que apenas os proprietÃ¡rios dos dados possam acessÃ¡-los.  Essa abordagem  foi testada em 30 aplicaÃ§Ãµes Java open-source e 7 aplicaÃ§Ãµes industriais, resultando na descoberta de 161 vulnerabilidades MOC confirmadas, das quais 73 foram atribuÃ­das a identificadores CVE, em comparaÃ§Ã£o com outras abordagens existentes, como o MACE, o MOCGuard demonstrou um desempenho superior em termos de precisÃ£o e recall.

name: Paras Jain
position: Business Owner at Be There Travels
text: As per the recent update from the US Embassy in India regarding significant changes to the visa appointment procedures, specifically for B-1/B-2 interview waiver appointments in New Delhi. This change aims to streamline the processing system for nonimmigrant visitor visas.  As you may know, B-1/B-2 visas allow individuals to temporarily enter the United States for business (B-1) or tourism/medical treatment (B-2). Applicants also have the option to apply for both (B-1/B-2), depending on their travel requirements.  Notably, the recent consolidation of interview waiver appointments exclusively in New Delhi marks a shift from the previous multiple location scheduling. This decision is intended to improve efficiency in Visa processing.  We are available to guide for the process and submission. You can feel free to reach us out in case of any further clarification.  Mail - Number - 7017915892

text: ğŸš¨ Navigating Citizenship Refusals: A Step-by-Step Guide to Appeals ğŸš¨  If your Australian citizenship application has been refused, you may have the right to appeal this decision! However, the appeal process is very different from visa refusals, and understanding the procedure is key to your success.  Hereâ€™s a breakdown of how it works:  1ï¸âƒ£ Key Difference: Unlike visa refusals, citizenship refusals are appealed to the General Division of the Administrative Review Tribunal (ART). 2ï¸âƒ£ Department Representation: The Department of Home Affairs will appoint lawyers to argue against your case during the merits review. 3ï¸âƒ£ T-Document Disclosure: Within 5 weeks of filing your application, the Department will serve you a T-documentâ€”a complete copy of your case file. 4ï¸âƒ£ Timelines to Prepare: The ART will schedule a case conference within 8â€“10 weeks of filing the appeal. This is much faster than visa refusal appeals, so preparation is crucial!  ğŸ’¡ Pro Tip: Be proactive! Understanding the T-document and preparing for the case conference early can set the stage for a strong appeal.  Stay tunedâ€”my next post will dive into the nuances of case conferences at the AAT and how to navigate them effectively!

name: Danielle Goldman
position: Building immigration solutions for foreign national innovators, entrepreneurs, and experts.
text: TLDR: change is coming in the immigration world ğŸŒ   Here our take at The Build Fellowship by Open Avenuesâ€¦  ğŸ‘‰Immediate Effects (1st Year):  H-1B Visa Policies: The administration might ease some H-1B restrictions but introduce new barriers like higher wage thresholds and stricter "specialty occupation" definitions.  Travel Bans and Consular Scrutiny: There may be a reinstatement and expansion of travel bans, leading to prolonged visa processing times and increased scrutiny for certain applicants.  Visa Backlogs: Efforts to address visa processing delays might be limited by staffing shortages and strict vetting procedures.  ğŸ‘‰Mid-Term Effects (Year 1-2):  Shift to Merit-Based H-1B System: The administration may pursue a merit-based H-1B system favoring highly skilled and highly paid applicants, requiring legislative approval.  Changes to OPT Program: Tighter eligibility and increased employer compliance for the OPT program could deter smaller companies and reduce international student enrollment.  Consular Processing: Additional resources may enhance security at consulates but maintain high scrutiny levels for applicants from high-risk countries.  ğŸ‘‰Long-Term Effects (Year 3-4):  Comprehensive Immigration Reform: The administration could prioritize permanent residency for highly skilled professionals while maintaining restrictive caps for other categories.  Domestic Visa Renewals: Allowing certain visa renewals within the U.S. could streamline processes but may be limited by strict vetting.  Consular Operations: Strategic appointments of officials may have lasting effects on visa processing standards, leading to persistent disparities.   Check out the full article â¬‡ï¸

name: Curtis Poling (åšæ—)
position: Accomplished CEO & Founder | Facilitating Asia & European CBI - US EB-5/ E-2 Visa Investment Programs | Bridging Global Talent & Opportunities
text: U.S. employers are on the verge of facing â€œthe largest labor shortage the country has ever seen,â€ according to a report from Lightcast, a leading labor market data and analysis firm. This crisis is driven by several factors, including the â€œSilver Tsunamiâ€ of Baby Boomers retiring, declining birth rates, a preference among younger generations for office-based jobs requiring college degrees, and a shrinking labor force participation rate among working-age adults. â€œBut this wasnâ€™t the storm itself; it was only a precursor to the real thing,â€ Lightcast warned. The retirement of Boomers is a structural change, not a cyclical one, and the declining labor force participation rate of younger generations will be difficult to reverse, the report explained. The convergence of these factors will result in crucial segments of the economy missing key workers, including the food services industry and police, firefighting and sanitation, Lightcast explained. This is creating what the namesake report calls, â€œThe Rising Storm.â€ â€œIt would be tempting to think the storm has passed â€” with â€˜The Great Resignationâ€™ over, the labor market will return to business as usual,â€ the report noted. At CN Global, weâ€™ve successfully placed numerous candidates during this challenging time, delivering outstanding results for both employers and employees. Let us help you navigate these workforce challengesâ€”reach out to us today! The EB-3 Visa Program: A Game-Changer for the Manufacturing Sector The EB-3 visa program provides a critical solution to labor shortages, particularly in manufacturing. By opening access to a global talent pool, it ensures businesses can secure reliable employees for essential roles that are increasingly difficult to fill domestically. Why EB-3 is the Future of Manufacturing Workforce Development: 1. Solving Labor Shortages: Manufacturing faces an ever-widening workforce gap, especially in entry-level positions where automation isnâ€™t a viable replacement. EB-3 workers can bridge this gap, ensuring smooth and efficient operations. 2. Workforce Stability and Retention: Unlike short-term work visas, the EB-3 program offers a pathway to permanent residency. This fosters long-term employee loyalty, reduces turnover, and provides companies with a dependable and stable workforce. 3. Enhancing Human Adaptability: While automation is transforming manufacturing, many roles still require human adaptability, problem-solving, and precisionâ€”skills that EB-3 workers bring to the table. 4. Driving Economic Growth: By filling critical labor gaps, EB-3 workers contribute to the expansion and sustainability of the manufacturing sector, driving broader economic growth and competitiveness. Amid ongoing domestic labor shortages, EB-3 workers are not just a temporary fix but a cornerstone of building a resilient, future-ready workforce for U.S. manufacturing. Connect with CN Global today to explore how we can help you thrive in this evolving labor market.

name: Dylan J. Hartmann
position: Founder @ AcudocX | PIC Finalist 2024 | Translating Futures â€“ together [Automated AI-assisted Certified Translation Workflow with Integrated Community]
text: Building AcudocX has been a journey of discovering the true impact of storytelling. Weâ€™re not just another translation service or tech platformâ€”weâ€™re pioneering something entirely unique. By redefining the certified translation process, weâ€™re addressing challenges others overlook and creating a space where technology meets and is enhanced by human connection.  AcudocX isnâ€™t just a tool for certified translations. Itâ€™s a platform that empowers migrants, translators, and businesses to thrive in a globalised world. By integrating technology with cultural sensitivity and human expertise, weâ€™re transforming whatâ€™s possible in certified translations and beyond. This is about more than language; itâ€™s about empowerment, dignity, inclusivity, and creating opportunity.  Our vision is big, and with that comes challenges. Not everyone will immediately see the value in democratising translation workflows or how this creates a win-win for clients and translators alike. And thatâ€™s okay. Disruption is often misunderstood at first.  But we know what AcudocX represents. Itâ€™s not just a platformâ€”itâ€™s a movement to break down barriers, foster connection, and reimagine how translation services can impact lives and industries. From enabling faster visa applications to helping translators build better businesses, the ripple effects of this innovation are immense.  Being the founder means holding the torch for this vision. It means telling the story again and again (comment below if you have heard my mining translation story from the Coup d'Ã©tat!), bridging the gap between todayâ€™s understanding and tomorrowâ€™s possibilities. Disruption isnâ€™t just about technologyâ€”itâ€™s about conviction, clarity, and staying true to your mission when others are still catching up.  AcudocX is here for those who believe in building a more connected, inclusive world. And I wonâ€™t compromise on that vision. It's about giving translators a tool to not only survive but thrive and compete in a ruthless industry.

text: Job Title: US Travel Sales Consultant  Location: Mohan Estate, South Delhi  Job Type: Full-time Shift: US shift (Rotational)  Job Description: We are seeking a dynamic and customer-oriented Us Travel Sales Consultant to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have 1 to 2 years of experience in the travel industry and a strong passion for helping clients plan and book their ideal trips. The Travel Consultant will be responsible for assisting customers with travel arrangements, providing expert advice on destinations, recommending travel packages, and ensuring a seamless travel experience from start to finish.  Key Responsibilities: â€¢ Client Consultation: Understand customer preferences, needs, and budget to recommend tailored travel itineraries, tours, and packages. â€¢ Booking and Reservations: Handle flight, hotel, car rental, and other travel-related bookings for clients. â€¢ Travel Advisory: Provide up-to-date information on destinations, local culture, weather, activities, and travel documentation (e.g., visas, vaccinations). â€¢ Sales: Promote and upsell travel products, services, and packages to meet sales targets and ensure customer satisfaction. â€¢ Documentation and Record-Keeping: Ensure accurate data entry, reservation records, and travel documentation. â€¢ Market Research: Stay informed about the latest travel trends, destinations, and promotions to provide informed advice to customers. â€¢ Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with customers   Requirements: â€¢ Experience: 1â€“2 years of experience in the travel industry, preferably in a customerfacing role such as a Travel Consultant, Travel Agent, or similar position. â€¢ Skills: o Strong communication skills (written and verbal). o Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities. o Proficiency in MS Office and travel booking software (e.g., Amadeus, Sabre, or other GDS systems is a plus). o Basic knowledge of travel industry trends and popular destinations.  â€¢ Attention to Detail: Ability to handle complex travel arrangements while ensuring accuracy. â€¢ Problem-Solving: Quick thinking and problem-solving skills to address any issues that may arise during the booking process or the trip itself. â€¢ PPC campaign Call Handling Experience required.  Benefits: â€¢ Competitive salary and lucrative incentives. â€¢ Opportunities for professional development and training. â€¢ Free meals â€¢ Cab services â€¢ Loyalty Bonus â€¢ Monthly outing/party  To apply contact on 9205699487 or share your resume on

name: Chirag Dudani
position: Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister | ex-BCG | YIF | SSCBS
text: My article in Hindustan Times co-authored with Sanjeev Sanyal.  For decades, India has been obsessively focused, on securing commitments for work visas in its trade negotiations, particularly when negotiating Free Trade Agreements (FTAs). This focus on work visas (referred to as Mode 4 in trade discussions) has frequently caused delays and in reaching agreements and forced India to yield substantial concessions in other areas. This fixation is outdated and potentially detrimental to economic interests. The demographic decline in developed economies already drives visa allocation without FTA commitments, as evidenced by a surge in US H-1B and German work visas. Post-pandemic digital service delivery (Mode 1) now constitutes 54% of total services exports, obviating physical presence requirements. Indian IT majors have reduced H-1B usage by 56%, while Western tech giants increased utilization substantially, becoming the primary beneficiaries of the visa program. The current strategy of prioritizing work visa commitments in FTAs essentially involves Indian negotiators advocating on behalf of Western multinationals, at the cost of significant concessions for Indiaâ€™s own economy. The article advocates abandoning visa negotiations in favor of pursuing concessions in goods, services, and investment frameworks, suggesting a 'Mode 5' approach for multi-modal delivery.

name: Alan Beck
text: I filed a new lawsuit with my co-counsel Kevin O'Grady. Hawaii maintains a complete ban on individuals owning firearms who live here pursuant to the Compact of Free Association (COFA) we have with various island nations. COFA allows people from those countries Micronesia, Palau and the Marshall Islands to enter the U.S. without a visa and live here as long as they want and we are allowed to do the same in their countries. Hawaii used to have a complete ban on noncitizens owning firearms. I filed a couple lawsuits which changed that. First for green card holders and then for U.S. Nationals. I had to do some follow up lawsuits for carry and against the counties to. After those lawsuits and the associated injunctions, Hawaii changed its laws to allows green card holders and U.S. Nationals to own guns. However, COFA aliens still can not own firearms because they are not legally permanent residents i.e. green card holders despite many living here on a permanent basis. My client has lived here for over 20 years and is completely law abiding. In his lawsuit we are alleging that Hawaii law violates his rights under the Second Amendment and under the Equal Protection Clause of the 14th Amendment. Linked to below is a copy of the complaint.

name: Ma Jun
position: Chairman of HKGFA | President of IFS | Chairman of CASI
text: Yesterday, I attended the ASEAN-China Forum 2024 hosted by the Centre on Contemporary China and the World of the University of Hong Kong. The first panel discussion, moderated by Professor Shi Han and featuring expertsandand myself, centered on identifying sustainable pathways for sustainable energy and development within the ASEAN region.  During the discussion, I highlighted the importance of a holistic approach, integrating policy, technology, and finance to advance sustainable development. On financing green transition, I discussed the interlinkage among key elements such as taxonomy, disclosure requirements, innovative financial products, as well as incentives offered by concessional interest rates, blended finance instruments, and voluntary carbon markets.  The panel also explored the critical role of capacity building in ASEAN and other emerging markets, where there is a pressing demand for transitioning to renewable energy sources. A major challenge was the scarcity of bankable green projects that can attract sufficient investment, underscoring the need for technical capacity to originate sustainable and profitable projects. Platforms such as theprovide the needed learning programs for bridging knowledge and skills gaps to develop local green finance markets and generate viable green projects.  Additionally, the panelists noted that China could be not only a supplier of low-cost green goods such as renewable equipment and EVs to ASEAN but also be an important source of demand for supporting ASEAN development. For example, I shared my view on the potential for Timor-Leste to attract a million Chinese tourists by adding direct flights, adjusting visa policies, and negotiating a tourism collaboration scheme with China.  In terms of regional collaboration, I gave two examples of how to develop win-win solutions between China and ASEAN. One is the potential for Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership ( ) to consider adding a â€œgreen trade policyâ€ element (by reducing tariff and non-tariff barriers on a list green goods) to enable faster decarbonization in the region and boost economic activities and employment in all member countries. The second example is the evolution from the Common Ground Taxonomy ( ) to the Multi-Jurisdiction Common Ground Taxonomy ( ), an initiative now jointly hosted by China, EU and Singapore that could facilitate green capital flows among China, EU, and ASEAN.  Speakers at the forum also highlighted Hong Kong's strategic position as a connector and facilitator for regional cooperation in areas such as trade, finance, advisory services, as well as development of regional standards.

name: nadeem shaikh
text: TURKEY VISA Processing kindly contact as +91 8369563657  To visit Turkey, you may need a visa, depending on your nationality and the purpose of your travel. Here's a general overview of the types of visas, the process, and requirements for obtaining a Turkish visa: 1. Types of Turkish Visas: Tourist Visa: For travelers visiting Turkey for tourism purposes. Business Visa: For people visiting for business meetings, conferences, or other professional activities. Student Visa: For those traveling to Turkey to study at a Turkish educational institution. Transit Visa: For travelers passing through Turkey to another country, for a short stopover. Work Visa: For those planning to work in Turkey. Family Visa: For family reunification or visiting family members in Turkey. 2. Visa Requirements: The general visa requirements for a Turkish visa may include: Passport: Must be valid for at least 6 months beyond the date of your planned entry to Turkey. Application Form: Complete the visa application form online or at the Turkish consulate/embassy. Photographs: Usually 1-2 passport-sized photographs. Proof of Accommodation: Hotel reservations, invitation letter, or accommodation arrangements. Travel Itinerary: Flight bookings or travel itinerary. Travel Insurance: Medical insurance valid for your stay in Turkey (for longer stays or certain visa types). Financial Proof: Evidence of sufficient funds to cover your stay (bank statements, pay slips). Visa Fee: Payment of the visa fee, which can vary based on nationality, type, and duration of stay. 3. E-Visa (Electronic Visa): Many nationalities can apply for an e-Visa for short visits (tourism, business, or transit). The e-Visa is an online visa that is quicker and easier to obtain than a traditional visa. Eligibility: Citizens of countries eligible for the e-Visa can apply via the official Turkish government e-Visa portal. Process: The process is entirely online. After filling out an online form, you can pay the visa fee and receive the e-Visa via email. Validity: The e-Visa is typically valid for up to 90 days within a 180-day period. 4. Visa on Arrival: Turkey offers Visa on Arrival for nationals of some countries. This allows you to obtain a visa when you arrive in Turkey, although the eligibility depends on your nationality. However, it's generally recommended to apply for an e-Visa or traditional visa beforehand to avoid potential delays. 5. How to Apply for a Turkish Visa: Online (E-Visa): If eligible, you can apply via the Turkish government's official e-Visa website:. Consulate/Embassy: If you are not eligible for an e-Visa, you will need to apply at a Turkish consulate or embassy in your home country. The procedure may require an appointment, submission of documents, and an in-person interview.

text: Direct flights between China and India, suspended for more than four years, may soon resume. name: CC Professor Jason Green, BA, MLIS
text: I havenâ€™t been on LinkedIn in a very long while. I checked my inbox and there are a suspicious number of â€œAngel Investmentâ€ DMâ€™s asking for lower sums of money in trade for services. Has LinkedIn become the new Facebook MLM? Itâ€™s odd that these accounts a very new and asking for a Google Document to be filled out and then a wire transfer to be sent. So, these people soliciting money would like for me to give them money, I provide the service, and then the â€œstartupâ€ provides me with an ROI for what? I know they are scams, but, if they want to scam me, then Iâ€™ll play along. Iâ€™ve asked them all for $50,000 upfront for my services and then after 6 months Iâ€™ll make an investment of the $25K first. Iâ€™ve had several people respond quickly saying â€œIf you make the investment now, then we will pay you the $50,000 after a six month period.â€ Iâ€™ve declined and said â€œIâ€™m sorry, I need to be paid upfront or Iâ€™ll take ownership of theâ€startupâ€ (legally) at 25%.â€ Theyâ€™ve mostly all responded by saying â€œOur company can give you $50,000 after you wire at least $12,500.00 first.â€ Wait, I thought the â€œAngel Investmentâ€ was $25K, now itâ€™s half off? Is that because of â€œBlack Friday?â€ ğŸ˜‚ Scammers will stop at nothing, will they? I certainly hope no one is actually falling for these things. I had one gentleman say that in order to prove his â€œstartupâ€ was real,if I Venmoâ€™ed him $10,000.00 as a good faith investment he would immediately Venmo wire transfer me $50,000.00 to prove it was real. So I send you money, you  send me 80% back to prove itâ€™s a real start up. What kind of craziness is this?Just send me the  $40,000.00 now and letâ€™s see how â€œrealâ€ this â€œreal start upâ€ is. After I agree to send the $10,000, the gentleman said â€œHeâ€™s a man of his wordâ€ and send me $40,000.00. But for what? They havenâ€™t even explained the business or its concept, just that money gets transferred to them, but to not send it to the â€œOfficial Startup Account,â€ but to a Gmail address because itâ€™s easier for tax purposes. Which non of it makes sense. So I agreed to all of this and then I was asked to get the largest amount of of Visa prepaid cards and send them the numbers so they could transfer money back to me afterwards. I declined and then they started getting belligerent and saying â€œYouâ€™re trying to scam our â€œstartup.â€ How is that possible when I have no idea what the start up is and now you want prepaid Visa card? ğŸ˜‚ You know someone is falling for this somewhere. Someone has given these people money or else they wouldnâ€™t keep doing it. We went from legitimate bank transfers to pre-paid Visa cards. There is a sucker horn every minute. Just for the fun of it, I started giving one scammers info to another scammer just to see what would happen. Havenâ€™t heard back from anyone yet after that. Please beware of the scammers. They will take any amount of money as they seem very desperate.

name: Prince Ubah Onyebuchi
text: As a seasoned immigration expert at Dreamland Travel Agency, I specialize in guiding individuals and families through the complex process of obtaining a Canadian visa. With extensive knowledge of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) regulations and procedures, I provide personalized support and expert advice to ensure a seamless and successful application process.  At Dreamland Travel Agency, we understand the importance of achieving your Canadian dreams. Our comprehensive Canada visa services include:  - Assessing eligibility and determining the best visa option - Preparing and submitting visa applications - Providing guidance on required documentation and supporting evidence - Coordinating with IRCC and other relevant authorities - Offering expert advice on settlement and integration in Canada  Whether you're seeking permanent residency, temporary residency, or citizenship, our dedicated team at Dreamland Travel Agency is committed to helping you achieve your Canadian goals. Let us navigate the complexities of the Canadian immigration system, so you can focus on building a brighter future in Canada.  Feel free to connect with me to discuss your Canadian visa needs or to learn more about our services at Dreamland Travel Agency.

name: Pradeep Anthony
position: "Business-Driven HR Leader | Transforming Talent Strategies for Growth | Digital Transformation & Leadership Hiring Expert"
text: Why Giving First Leads to True Happiness: A thanksgiving lesson from a Village College  During my trip to India in September, I visited St. Charles College of Arts and Sciences in Eraiyur village, Tamil Nadu, to join the students and faculty in celebrating their convocation ceremony. This small village, home to 2000 families, is surrounded by over 75 smaller hamlets, all served by this humble yet impactful college. Witnessing the graduation of the second batch of students was a deeply moving experience.  Unlike the grand convocations Iâ€™ve attended in the past, this ceremony was striking in its simplicity. No elaborate stages or grand gesturesâ€”just pure, heartfelt moments. Yet, it left an indelible mark on me, reminding me that true impact doesnâ€™t need pomp or show.  As we recently celebrated Thanksgiving, this experience took on even greater meaning. Thanksgiving is a time to reflect on the blessings in our lives and the importance of giving back. The convocation at St. Charles reminded me of the transformative power of education and the role of values, integrity, strength, and ambition in building a brighter futureâ€”not just for oneself, but for others as well.  In speaking to the students, I shared what I believe to be a guiding framework for personal and professional success, which I called their VISA for life.  â€¢ V â€“ Values: Stay grounded in your values, which will guide you in making the right decisions. â€¢ I â€“ Integrity: Always act with integrity, for it earns trust and respect. â€¢ S â€“ Strength: Draw on your inner strength to overcome challenges, as the road to success is never easy. â€¢ A â€“ Ambition: Let your ambition fuel your drive to achieve and make an impact.  This framework isnâ€™t just for students; itâ€™s equally relevant for those of us navigating the corporate world. Our values define us, integrity builds trust, strength helps us persevere, and ambition drives innovation and growth.  As I reflect on this experience and the spirit of Thanksgiving, I am reminded that happiness is not in receiving but in giving first. One need not be at the forefront to create an impact; often, greater impact can be created by leading from the side. Whether itâ€™s institutions like St. Charles College or the thousands of others quietly working to transform lives, they remind us of the immense power of giving. Supporting such institutionsâ€”through time, effort, or resourcesâ€”not only empowers students and uplifts communities but also ensures that the cycle of opportunity continues for generations to come.  When we embrace this spirit of giving firstâ€”both in life and at workâ€”we lay the foundation for lasting impact and true fulfillment.

text: Exciting News: Expansion of the H-2B Visa Program for FY 2025!  I'm thrilled to share that the United States is expanding its H-2B visa program, offering 64,716 additional visas for the fiscal year 2025. This expansion is a significant stride towards addressing labor shortages in essential non-agricultural sectors such as hospitality, construction, and landscaping.  Key Highlights:- - Increased Workforce: The addition of new visas will support businesses struggling to fill seasonal roles, helping them meet demand while boosting economic growth. - Diverse Opportunities: This move opens up diverse opportunities for foreign workers looking to contribute their skills to the U.S. economy. - Economic Impact: By boosting the workforce, industries that rely on seasonal labor can maintain operations and continue to thrive.  This expansion reflects a balanced approach to immigration, addressing the needs of the economy while providing new opportunities for foreign workers. As we navigate these changes, itâ€™s crucial for businesses and HR professionals to stay informed and ensure compliance with visa regulations.  Let's embrace this opportunity to strengthen our workforce and drive innovation across industries. What are your thoughts on this development? How will it impact your sector?    -

name: Yukiya Usami
position: MSc in Financial Modelling & Investment at Glasgow | East-West Investments, Pinpoint Asset Management, Wells Fargo, Bloomberg
text: My post yesterday has been incredibly viral, more than 30000 impression... I couldn't believe it still now. Let me explain some things in more detail.  Firstly, surely, I couldn't reach out to the dream jobs of Macro Trader/Researcher, Quantitative Trader/Researcher, Portfolio Analyst/Associate, Investment analyst/associate for Multi-Asset. However, If you are open to expand the range of vacancies in terms of Location, Job Content and so forth (ex. out of London, or operational roles), it will be much easier to get a job in the financial institution in terms of competitiveness and eligibility.(Still I was rejected at more than 99% operational roles applications...when it comes to front office job hunting, 99.99% of my job applications were rejected lol)  However, I didn't make much of expanding the range of acceptable vacancies because they will not lead me to my career goal of Macro(Multi-Asset) Portfolio Manager/Fund Manager/Strategist in UK Asset Management Company/Hedge Fund in the future. Thus, I decided to add related working experience in Japan, which I think will be more advantageous for my final career goal.  Secondly, when it comes to the reason why I couldn't get the job, I found 2 main factors at the current point. The first is the shortage of my educational background. If you want to go to the front office in the investment bank or asset management company (hedge fund etc...) in the UK, it's better to have Master's degree at University of Cambridge, Oxford, Imperial, LSE, LBS, UCL and so on. Especially, if you want to get quantitative roles or trader roles, you should have STEM degree in top universities. Secondly, my ability and experience is short at all in terms of experienced hiring and graduate scheme. I didn't have permanent front office experience, and the middle office experience was only a year. It was completely next to nothing. When it comes to Graduate Scheme, I couldn't pass the online assessment of numerical/logical reasoning in English. There are some VISA regulations, but I know some people who is really smart and get the graduate level hedge fund jobs/investment banking jobs from top universities. Thus, VISA regulation isn't the complete factor which prevent you from being inaugurated.  This terrible result is completely owing to my lack of ability. That's it. So if you are confident and smart, it will be worth trying!  Last but not least, I subscribed some support business such as automated writing resume according to AI Screening, or the networking and connection service, or some internship with much fee. It didn't give me good result, at least in my case, so I wouldn't recommend.(Maybe is it only me or?)  Anyway, Thank you for seeing my post. I maybe retry in the future with much more experience!  Kind Regards, Yukiya

name: Service and Creative Skills Australia (SaCSA)
text: On 3 December 2024, the Australian Government announced the release of the Core Skills Occupation List (CSOL). SaCSA welcomes the inclusion of these occupations.  The CSOL is informed by labour market analysis and stakeholder consultations by(JSA). It will shape migration settings, specifically the new Core Skills stream of the new Skills in Demand visa, from 7 December 2024. The CSOL will also apply to the Direct Entry stream of the permanent Employer Nomination Scheme visa.  Why Being on the List Matters:  Inclusion on the CSOL allows employers to access Australiaâ€™s skilled migration pathways to address workforce shortages. It ensures businesses can sponsor skilled workers for critical roles, supports workforce stability, and aligns migration policy with industry needs. These targeted solutions can help address workforce and skills needs.  SaCSAâ€™s Role in Contributing to the CSOL:  SaCSA conducted an in-depth analysis and gathered industry stakeholder feedback to ensure that occupations across our sectors were represented in the CSOL. This included SaCSAâ€™s input to JSA for the 2024 Occupation Shortage List (OSL) which informs CSOL, as well as surveys and submissions for the draft CSOL itself.  Thank you to all stakeholders who engaged with us in this process. To learn more, or read the list in full, visit:

name: Pacific Australia Labour Mobility (PALM) scheme
text: The Department of Home Affairs recently cancelled the visa of a foreign national who was operating as an unlawful provider of immigration assistance while in Australia.  This person had charged more than 1,000 visa applicants a lot of money for immigration advice, telling them to apply for a Protection visa despite knowing they were not eligible and would be refused.  This was not only illegal; it also caused unnecessary delays to the applications of asylum seekers and others who genuinely need Australiaâ€™s protection.  Under Australian law, only registered migration agents and Australian legal practitioners can charge a fee for providing immigration assistance.

name: Arnela Tolic
position: Lawyer (Immigration/Employment Law)| Accredited NMAS Mediator| CPD Lecturer| Business Coach ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ«
text: Skills in Demand (SID) Visa Launches: A Game-Changer for Migrants and Employers  On 7 December 2024, Australia introduces the Skills in Demand (SID) Visa, a significant step toward addressing workforce shortages and attracting global talent to priority industries.  Central to this initiative is the new Core Skills Occupation List (CSOL), which replaces the outdated Skilled Occupation List (SOL) with a focused approach to economic growth.  What is the CSOL? The CSOL targets high-demand roles crucial for Australiaâ€™s economy, based on up-to-date labour market analysis and industry consultation.  New Occupations: Key Highlights Technology and Cybersecurity Cyber Security Engineer DevOps Engineer Data Scientist Agriculture and Aquaculture Aquaculture Scientist Animal Husbandry Technician Skilled Trades & Emerging Roles Furniture Maker Content Creator Regulatory Affairs Manager  These updates reflect Australiaâ€™s push for talent in cutting-edge fields and essential services.  OSCA: A New Classification System The Occupation Standard Classification for Australia (OSCA) replaces ANZSCO, refining specialisations like:  Agronomist (formerly Agricultural Scientist). Respiratory Technician (previously Medical Technicians NEC).  Exclusions and Transition Deadlines Some roles, including CafÃ© Manager, Copywriter, and Chiropractor, are excluded. Employers must finalise nominations for these by the transition deadline.  Benefits of the SID Visa For Employers Streamlined access to global talent in critical roles. A more focused occupation list to address workforce needs.  For Migrants Lower eligibility thresholds (1 year of experience). Clear pathways in high-demand industries.  Key Legal Considerations Sponsorship Obligations Align roles with the CSOL.  Provide competitive salaries and demonstrate local recruitment efforts. Visa Conditions for Migrants  Work in the approved occupation and maintain compliance records. Transition from SOL to CSOL  Review and adjust pending applications to meet the new standards. OSCA Adjustments  Consult migration professionals for alignment under the new framework.  Get Expert Assistance The SID visa is a bold step forward, but navigating its complexities requires professional guidance. Contact Tolic Lawyers for expert advice on how employers and migrants can maximise this opportunity.  Letâ€™s build Australiaâ€™s future together. More to be published tomorrow- WATCH this space.

text: Australians donâ€™t want to do the work? Letâ€™s talk about it.  If you have missed the news, top restaurants in Sydney are raising alarms over the difficulty of finding Australians to work in hospitality. The numbers donâ€™t lieâ€”8 out of 10 businesses are hiking pay or improving conditions to attract talent.  At Gig Space, we are no strangers to these challenges. We see the same story playing out across tourism, marine, and entertainment. While thereâ€™s no denying the pressures on migration and visa policies, I firmly believe the solution goes beyond pointing fingers. Itâ€™s about bridging the gap.  Our platform connects passionate professionalsâ€”whether they are locals or internationalâ€”with opportunities that match their skills and aspirations. Talent isnâ€™t about nationality; itâ€™s about people who care, who show up, and who are ready to make an impact.  Yes, policy changes affect industries. But so does innovation, collaboration, and rethinking how we tap into untapped potential. With the right tools and mindset, we can ensure industries like hospitality (and beyond) thrive, regardless of the barriers in place.  If you are a business struggling to find the right talent or a professional seeking your next gig, we are here to help!

name: Shubham Chakraborty
position: Writer for hire | Blogs, Articles, Whitepapers, Social Media | ex-MMT, ToI, GAIL | XLRI, NIT Bhopal
text: India's most searched travel destinations in 2024 (Google search) puts Azerbaijan at #1.  Surpriaingly, there's no European destination in the list. It's a welcome development.  With Schengen visa's super high rejection rates, it's about time we look for other destinatikns to spend our money.  From the past few year's Indian tourists have flocked to Central Asian countries like Kazakhstan, Georgia, Uzbekistan, etc.  I went to Georgia this year, beautiful country, warm hospitality, and a good outlook towards Indians (no racism) ensured we had a really good experience.  If you need a 10-day Georgia itinerary that I made for the trip, feel free to DM me.

name: Himmat Anand
text: Google is the undisputed Bible of Search. Below is their list of Top Trending Searches for Travel - India. And a few things stand out as I go through this list.  * Outbound Travel is on a given high. Five of the ten top destinations are international. A growth of some 18% year on year in this segment will be no surprise. *All these international destinations are now offering direct and reasonably priced flights. With Indian aviation growing, direct flight to global points is bound to increase and be the draw for travel. *These destinations are also offering visa on arrival - a huge plus, given the cumbersome visa process of Europe and the US. Another trend indicator.  On the other hand, the domestic destinations did surprise me a bit. Manali, South Goa, Ayodhya may be on the list of 'most searched' but are definitely not on the list of 'most visited'. Hence just searches don't really translate into business, just as Likes on a Post doesn't mean conversions.

name: Nomos
text: The Family Violence provisions in Division 1.5 of the Migration Regulations 1994 (Cth) will apply to the below visas from 17 December 2024:  - Parent (subclass 103); - Remaining Relative (subclasses 115 and 835); - Carer (subclasses 116 and 836); - Business Talent (subclass 132); - Contributory Parent (subclass 143); - Pacific Engagement (subclass 192); - Aged Parent (subclass 804); - Contributory Aged Parent (subclass 864); and - Business Innovation and Investment (subclass 888).  The government has repeatedly stated its position that a secondary applicant should not feel compelled to stay in a violent relationship for a visa outcome, and it appears that they intend to follow through with the expansion of these provisions to more visas in the program.

text: Israeli soldiers denied entry into Australia following war crimes visa questions  Troops face scrutiny in Australian visa applications over their potential involvement in genocidal acts  Protesters wave Palestinian flags during a demonstration against Israel in Sydney on 15 May, 2021 (AFP)  By Elis Gjevori  Published date: 13 December 2024
